Frontend.skills: React, Angular, jQuery, JSON, HTML5, CSS3 and CSS
Frontend.jobDescription:
Senior Front-End Developer


Salary - commensurate with experience
Must be authorized to work in U.S. without sponsorship
Who we are looking for:


MarketOnce is searching for a highly driven front-end developer who is committed to excellence.  While we are not concerned with your previous framework experience, you must be willing to dive deep into React.  You will be focused on architecting and coding bulletproof production applications in a collaborative environment, and will be expected to lead and mentor a team of frontend developers while doing so.

Who are we?


MarketOnce is a product company that is working on building a new sales and marketing automation platform.  We have a clear vision and goals to accomplish this feat and we are looking for driven, like-minded people to help us get there.

MarketOnce consists of around 20 people (devs, designer, tester, DBA) that care about each other and our work.  We are a tight-knit, work-family that live through our core values and fight in the trenches together every day. The team never hesitates to help each other. Although we are all very different people, we are tied together by a common goal of excellence and growth.  In that pursuit, you will have a lot of responsibility and be expected to contribute every single day.  We look forward to meeting you and having you share a little bit of who you are with us.

The position entails:

Architecting manageable, scalable frontend code
Facilitating implementation of technical designs and solutions utilizing modern software development patterns and practices
Providing frontend technical guidance to cross-functional teams 
Fully testing and troubleshooting work, ensuring consistently error-free, high-quality results
Interacting with clients and internal stakeholders to help guide product decisions
Accurately estimating level of effort and timelines for individual and group projects
Mentoring junior team members, ensuring that code standards and deadlines are consistently met.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to conceptualize and build new features

Knowledge and skill requirements:

Expert level JavaScript programming - frameworks like React, Angular, jQuery, etc.
Expert in browser testing, debugging, and performance optimization
Expert understanding of JSON
Expert at integrating with REST APIs, synchronously and asynchronously
Strong working knowledge in HTML5, CSS3 and CSS preprocessors like Sass
Strong working knowledge with build tools like grunt, gulp, and webpack
Strong understanding of best practices for designing and developing web applications
Understanding of functional programming
Experience with Object Oriented Design
Experience with automation tools & Test Driven Development
Initiative to improve process, tools, and quality of product

Knowledge and skills that would help you stand out:

Experience developing APIs with any of the server-side programming languages, especially C#
Experience developing with TypeScript
Knowledge of digital marketing
A natural tendency to stay on top of and experiment with new tech

Other expectations:

You live our Core Values
You have a wide range of interest in the technology world
You have demonstrated enthusiasm for people and software development
You are often learning new skills, quickly
You are open to reviewing code and having your code reviewed
No excuses, no drama, no BS

What are our core values?


Reliable


“Reliability is the foundation to strong relationships.”
We hold ourselves accountable and can always be trusted to deliver on our commitments.
We are responsive and easily accessible.
We are honest and willing to say no.

Thoughtful


“Our thoughtfulness drives optimal, intentional results.”
We believe thoughtfulness fosters deeper relationships and minimizes unintended consequences.
We take full and deep consideration of how we affect the people around us and the potential impact of our decisions and actions.

Pragmatic


“Optimal outcomes are achieved by respecting real-world constraints.”
When knowledge is rooted in practice, results are higher quality and more predictable.
We break down situations to their essence and apply our practical experience to create common-sense solutions.

Team-Oriented


“We accomplish more as a team.”
We communicate openly and collaborate effectively.
We rely on each other's strengths and empower each other with empathy and encouragement.
We commit to supporting team members through any challenges they may face. We learn and grow together.

Continuously Improving


“We strive to become the best versions of ourselves.”
We are forever learners that grow through our successes and mistakes.
We are not only open to feedback, but we seek it out.
Our humility opens us up to learn from everyone.

Driven


“Good enough isn’t good enough.”
We always strive to go above and beyond, even when no one is looking.
We are constantly seeking new challenges.
No matter what we're doing, we're giving it 100%.

Frontend.skills: Agile, AngularJS, Architecture, Automated, Broadband, Database, Development, Iterative, JavaScript, MySQL, mysql, Programming, Security, SQL, Testing, UX, Version Control, Video
Frontend.jobDescription:
What you’ll be doing... 


You’re passionate and curious about technology, drones, aviation, or all of the above. You have experience working with 100% SaaS architecture, peer mentorship and implementation of front-end architectures using React. As a Senior Front-End Engineer, you will design, develop, and implement new capabilities for the Skyward Platform that scale and encourage best practice. You will participate in a collaborative Agile team environment and build features that not only meet customer requirements, but help Skyward pave the future in a incredibly innovative industry. 

Responsibilities and Duties  


Actively participate as part of a team of engineers responsible for the Skyward Platform. 

Utilize the React framework to structure new UI’s with an eye towards deprecating the Angularjs pieces of our application. 

Contribute to Agile team ceremonies such as planning, scoping and retrospectives. 

Work with UX specialists to make interfaces appealing, easy, attractive and simple. 

Collaborate with back-end engineers to evolve architectural best practices that ensure scalable, reusable and reliable implementations. 

Provide mentorship for the team and align around front-end best practices utilizing React. 

Practice, teach and evolve our front-end testing strategy utilizing Test Driven Development techniques. 

Participate in code reviews and pair programming exercises that encourage continuous learning. 

Keep abreast of technology trends and work to apply them when appropriate.  

What we’re looking for... 


Development expertise with a solid understanding of Javascript, React, HTML5, and CSS3 

Familiarity with, but not an expert at, Angularjs 1.X 

Expertise and demonstratable experience leveraging architectural patterns for integrating React frameworks 

Experience with building responsive Single Page Applications using RESTful web services and processing JSON data 

Experience with enterprise systems (and related frameworks like Spring Boot), SSO frameworks/approaches, and data stores 

Experience with continuous integration application delivery, including provisioning, deployment, testing and version control 

Experience developing and implementing automated unit tests using technologies like JUnit, JSUnit, Jest, Enzyme and other xUnit testing frameworks 

Experience working within an Agile team environment 

A knack for benchmarking and optimization  


Required  


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience 

6+ years of front-end development experience 

2+ years integrating React frameworks and functionality 

2+ years experience with database technologies (Postgres, MySql, etc) including SQL 

Ability to work in a highly collaborative Agile team 

Demonstrated aptitude and desire to learn new skills 

Excellent written and verbal communication skills 

Ability to embrace change and work in a fast paced, iterative environment 

Ability to develop an understanding of the commercial UAS marketplace and customers’ needs  


Preferred 

Experience working in a startup environment 

Test Driven Development Experience a plus 

PostGIS experience  

When you join Verizon... 


You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon.

Frontend.skills: Computers General
Frontend.jobDescription:
About CBRE (NYSE: CBG):  At CBRE, you are empowered to take your career path into your own hands. Enjoy workplace flexibility in a global organization with tremendous scale. Work in an inclusive and collaborative environment with supportive teammates. Come experience the employee advantage at CBRE.

CBRE has a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law. 
 
As a Fortune 500 worldwide leader in real estate services, CBRE's more than 70,000 professionals provide exceptional outcomes for clients in 60+ countries.  When it comes to real estate, CBRE sees potential everywhere. We turn scale into strength, expense into performance, and property into prosperity. 
 

Description/Opportunity:We're looking for a front-end software engineer (3+ years of experience) who can hit the ground running to help us expand our existing platform and associated client-facing (web and mobile) applications. This person would begin immediately as a full-time employee in Seattle, WA.

Backed by senior CBRE executives, our small, fast-paced team is on a mission to change the space of commercial real estate through our suite of simple, intuitive client-side applications.  

Our current infrastructure is loosely comprised of:
* A flexible, scalable, cloud-based application layer 
* An API layer for client-side consumption
* Client-side applications designed for specific user groups

As our platform continues to grow, we would like you to help expand and improve the capabilities of our front-end and mobile applications.  Though you will have the opportunity to touch many different technologies (scrum teams work on the entire stack), your primary responsibility would be developing the frontend components of our client-facing applications.  Proficiency in JavaScript and related frameworks (such as AngularJS), knowledge of other current front-end tools, and a passion for learning new technologies is required.

Your responsibilities will include:* Writing beautiful code and implementing fantastic solutions for our client-facing web and mobile applications
* Working with other engineers to establish and document coding best practices based on industry standards
* Working with a team of engineers (with a variety of technical capabilities), along with a Scrum Master, to identify, spec, and implement elegant features and solutions
* Ensuring that we are continuously raising our standard of engineering excellence
* Identifying and addressing bugs/enhancements/new features/refactoring requirements





Qualifications: * Professional experience with JavaScript, HTML5/CSS3 (& SCSS)
* Experience with AngularJS, or a similar framework
* Strong background with MVC testing frameworks such as Karma, JSHint, and Protractor 
* A solid understanding of Git, or a similar version control system
* Experience with Agile/Scrum software development cycles
Bonus points for experience in these areas:* Automation of end-to-end testing frameworks across device types
* Background with D3.js, strong plus
* Some basic UX/UI or Design skills
* Solid understanding of JavaScript mapping libraries, such as Leaflet, and GIS technologies, such as ESRI
* Experience with iOS and/or Android application development
* Experience with Ionic or a related framework
* Familiarity with bug reporting tools, triaging, and processes


We offer:
* A competitive compensation package, with medical/dental/vision/401(k)/disability/conference attendance, etc.
* An awesome team with whom to collaborate 
* A commitment to your career (plus a generous annual continued education stipend)
* An open-source culture that encourages learning and contributing back to the community
* Flexible working environment in a downtown Seattle office that's convenient to mass transit and the Seattle bus tunnel



Sample of the technologies we use:Backend App/API - Python 3, Django, Django Rest Framework, Celery, Pandas, NumPy, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL/PostGIS
Infrastructure & Related - AWS, Rundeck, Terraform, GitLab CI, Ubuntu
Development Workflow - Jira, GitLab, Slack
Client-Side, Single Page Apps - AngularJS (1.x and 2.x), D3.js, ESRI, Leaflet, Ionic, VueJS

About our team:We're a software engineering team within CBRE's Digital and Technology group. We are uniquely positioned within the organization to access global data, tools, resources, and leaders throughout the industry. Our mission is to create value by developing targeted, highly scalable technology platforms for internal and external consumption.

We solve complex commercial real estate problems by bringing together good people, great minds, and top tier technologies. We believe in leveraging and supporting open source projects and their broader communities whenever possible. We love Unix-based systems (we use Macs) but appreciate other flavors. We believe that personal growth is as important as Company growth, and they are interdependent.

For more information about our team, please visit: http://www.cbredev.com



Learn more about CBRE Technology at: http://www.cbre.com/about/tech-vantage


Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer
Women/Minorities/Persons with Disabilities/US Veterans

Frontend.jobDescription:
American Specialty Health, Incorporated (ASH)




2009 – 2014 Fastest-Growing Private Companies in America—Inc. 5000


2014 Healthiest Companies—San Diego Business Journal


2014 Workforce 100 Winner—Workforce Management


2014 Coolest Companies to Work For: San Diego—O.C. Tanner


2008  – 2011 & 2013 Best Employers for Healthy Lifestyles, Gold—National Business Group on Health


 

American Specialty Health, Inc. is seeking a passionate and analytical individual looking to contribute his/her skills and leadership to the Front End Engineering team.  The Software Engineer II, Front End is responsible for creating single page apps, while working closely with, and providing support to, front end developers, software (API) engineers, designers, and product owners. He or she will be expected to help mentor Associate Software Engineers, Front End and interns. 


EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s degree in human-computer interaction, computer science, or a related degree (or equivalent experience).  High school diploma required.




EXPERIENCE:

2+ years experience developing and architecting single page applications that adhere to web standards, using a JavaScript framework such as Ember, Angular, React, etc., while consuming APIs in a RESTful or JSON API format


Experience building websites that adhere to mobile-first functionality and fluid layouts


Experience writing clean, reusable, optimized, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript


Experience creating reusable components for use across multiple apps in the form of web components, or components as defined in Ember, React, Vue, Angular, etc. We use Ember, so experience with Ember is a plus


1+ year writing ES2015, as well as Node.js


Experience writing tasks in Gulp.js or a similar build tool


Experience writing unit, integration, and acceptance/UI tests

Experience working in an agile environment

 

What makes American Specialty Health (ASH) such an awesome place to work? There are MANY perks, including:



Offices located across the country in San Diego, Dallas, Indianapolis, and South Carolina


Healthyroads Coaching® for Weight Management, Tobacco Cessation, and Healthy Living at no cost to employees


Healthy vending machines


An onsite fitness center and an exercise room, showers, and locker rooms at our San Diego and Dallas offices, plus discounted gym memberships through the Active&Fit® program


Incentives program -- employees and spouses can receive discounts on annual health care premiums for reaching specific physical activity goals using wireless activity monitors and completing other healthy activities


Corporate awards ceremony for employees, featuring an awards presentation that honors ASH employees


Holiday and employee health challenges with fun incentives


Onsite health education classes


Wellness team

Athletic event reimbursement



American Specialty Health Incorporated (ASH) is a national health services company that provides population health management programs including prevention and wellness services, specialty health care management programs, and fitness and exercise services to health plans, insurance carriers, employer groups, and trust funds.



Since its inception in 1987, ASH has been based in San Diego and now has regional offices in Dallas and Indianapolis. Currently, ASH has over 1,000 employees. ASH subsidiaries operate in all 50 states, providing access to contracted practitioners with administrative platform for clients. ASH clients include more than 132 health plans nationwide.



In addition, ASH offers employees many opportunities for education and advancement, plus an awards program that honors employee achievement in the areas of Quality, Customer Service, Teamwork and Innovation.



ASH has also been named among the 100 “Best Places to Work in Healthcare” by Modern Healthcare
 magazine, one of America’s 15 Fittest Companies by Men’s Fitness
 magazine, a National Business Group on Health Gold “Best Employers for Healthy Lifestyles” award winner, and a California Task Force on Youth and Workplace Wellness Fit Company. More locally, ASH has been named one of San Diego's best places to work by the San Diego Business Journal
 and San Diego Magazine.




In addition to our more unique health care benefits, we provide employees with a wide array of more traditional benefits. They include:



Medical, dental, and vision coverage


Matching 401(k) savings and retirement plan


11 paid holidays annually


Paid personal time off to be used for vacation, sick time, etc.


Life, AD&D, and long-term disability insurance


Employee discounts to local restaurants, movie theaters, fitness clubs, and theme parks


Public transportation reimbursement (up to $75 per month)


Employee Assistance Program


Flexible health care spending account


Software training classes


Monthly seminars

Tuition reimbursement



So why not choose one of its finest companies to work for? Explore our website to find out more about our company, our values, and our open positions. Start changing lives—and your idea of “work”—today!

 

Please click the link below to apply for the Software Engineer II, Front End position: https://www.ashcompanies.com/Careers/JobDescription?jobCode=17-0266

If this current position does not fit your area of expertise, please visit us online to view our current list of available positions. www.ashcompanies.com
American
Specialty Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. 



Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP at the following website http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/then scroll down to Federal Contractor Corner, Workplace Posters and click on "EEO is the Law".

 

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career center as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation, contact our Human Resources Department at (800) 848-3555 x6702.



ASH will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company’s legal duty to furnish information.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Front End Engineer 
 
  
  The Business Entity  
   
 The Core Software Group (CSG) has the charter for all Platform Independent and Platform Dependent software development across Switching (for data center, campus core and campus access), wireless, network services, routing, optical software and Enterprise routing and cable access. CSG is creating unprecedented customer value by providing cohesive and innovative software, platforms and solutions for Cisco's core networking customers.    
  Who You'll Work With 
   
 You will work directly with senior executives, architects and a cohesive group of high performing - platform, big data and analytics engineers, UI/UX Leads and QA Leads. You will engage with multiple teams across the Engineering, IT and Support orgs at senior levels on an ongoing basis.   
  What You'll Do 
   
 *       Hands-on development and write code, prototype reference architectures, build base / core modules for the platform front end using cutting edge technology stack   
 *       Research on trending and potential future technologies and bring them in to advance the DNA Platform   
 *       Evaluate current state (data and platform front end architectures) and identify incremental opportunities to improve our performance, efficiency and scale   
 *       Strengthen the direction of the team in picking the correct tool / technology   
 *       Help solve some of our business’ most critical visual technical challenges, provide simple solutions to complex visual and usability challenges   
 *       Work on  a platform and product engineering mindset within the team   
 *       Help translate high level requirements to actionable tasks / deliverables   
 *       Work along with UX, product management and  leadership teams, as the frontend / application engineering team member 
  
  Who You Are 
   
 The ideal candidate must enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment with a “take-charge” / “can-do” attitude and is able to demonstrate flexibility and resiliency.  Work with geographically distributed teams across different time zones.  As a key engineering team member, tag along core group of engineers, senior leadership, product management and customers to deliver cutting edge systems and platforms. You will design, develop and deploy the face of one of the largest and most complex data / integration platforms and solve one of the most challenging scaling requirements that is deployed on the cloud as well as on-prem.   
      
  Minimum Qualifications:  
   
 *       Bachelor's degree (Master’s a Plus) in engineering/computer science with an overall work experience of  5+ years with considerable software and platform development skills.   
 *       Solid understanding of very large scale, high performance, real-time, cloud agnostic platforms and solutions   
 *       Distinguish pros and cons of competing technology stacks and clearly articulate and recommend best suited solutions.   
 *       Experience in Reactive Programming methodology, built application platforms and frontend platforms that gets utilized by external developers and apps.   
 *       Expertise in building modular, componentized, metadata driven visual components that clearly demonstrate their server-side and client-side responsibilities and capabilities   
 *       Proficiency in skills in NodeJS, React/Redux/Angular/JavaScript/HTML/CSS, MongoDB    
 *       Experience in multi-tenant system design, cloud and container based deployments, API Gateways, integrations and workflows   
 *       Strong verbal and written / documentation / presentation skills   
      
  Pluses: 
 
 *       Product engineering experience    
 *       Be highly flexible and adaptable and demonstrate passion for platform development   
        
 Why Cisco 
  
We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with rare personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. 
We are leaders with vision, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers. 
 
We Are Cisco.   
Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment ,  on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  
#LI-RS1 
#DICEDEV

Frontend.jobDescription:
Job Description 


Are you someone who has a passion for front end website development using HTML5 and CSS3?   Look no further, ProfitStars Web Solutions team has a place for you. The ProfitStars Web Solutions team is an industry leader in the design and creation of cutting edge web sites for financial institutions. ProfitStars Web Solutions is looking to hire a Front End Website Developer who will translate new design files into dynamic, responsive websites built to the latest standards. JavaScript/jQuery is essential, experience working with a framework such as Foundation or Bootstrap would be beneficial.  This position will be open to being worked out of the Brentwood, TN for Jack Henry & Associates. You may travel up to 5% to attend a JHA meeting, training, or conference.  


Currently have 12 website developers that are distributed across various JHA locations. Web developers work closely with designers, project coordinators, and fellow developers to build, edit, and maintain sites. Ideal candidate should be interested in learning and staying up to date with new technologies.  In this role and environment you will have the opportunity to utilize build automation tools such as Grunt and Gulp. You will also get exposure to working with stylesheet scripting languages like LESS and SASS. In addition, any prior experience with Content Management Systems (CMS) is helpful.    


ProfitStars Web Solutions offers a collaborative, team based environment that allows you to work with and share knowledge with a family of very talented individuals who take pride in building top quality web sites for financial institutions. ProfitStars offers a flexible schedule, great benefits, and a casual work environment. If you are interested in this position, please apply on or before February 9, 2018.  

 MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS 
Bachelor’s degree is required. 
Must have a minimum of 3 years of experience with front end website development with a combination of  HTML5 and CSS3; development must be from scratch.   
Must have work experience with both JavaScript / JQuery; utilize existing plugins. 
Must be able to provide copies or online portfolio to demonstrate work examples. 

 PREFERRED SKILLS 
Any previous experience with web frameworks (Bootstrap, Foundation, etc.) is preferred. 
Usage of build automation tools (Grunt, Gulp, etc.) is preferred. 
Experience with stylesheet scripting languages (LESS, SASS, etc.) is preferred 
Experience with Content Management Systems is preferred.  

 ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS 
Develop websites based off of designs to meet today's modern day standards. 
Update currently developed websites in ProfitStars content management system. 
Be able to work 1 on 1 as well as participate in group discussions. 
Peer review other’s work. 
Creates web site templates per design specifications. 
Adds or updates web site templates and content in the content management system. 
Builds and reviews web pages and scripts  to ensure they are correct and compatible with the latest and most common versions of popular web browsers. 
Researches, tests, and quality checks new scripts and technologies to incorporate into web projects. 
Logs development time and details in project management systems. 
Works closely with and provides feedback to project team members to create and maintain web sites. 
Works with junior and senior level team members to accomplish other web site tasks.

The Creative Group  is looking for an outstanding Senior Front End Engineer to join a stellar and cutting-edge company in Southlake, Texas.

experience for a global driver of quality assurance in laboratory medicine. nbsp; This is a full-time, direct-hire role in  Northfield, Illinois.

 nbsp;

5+ years rsquo; experience in front-end development and 2 years building websites with WordPress 
Mastery of web and mobile programming languages and packages, such as, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, or other web frameworks and experience with UI components, Javascript libraries/frameworks, font libraries, and grid systems

Frontend.skills: API, Architecture, Browser, CSS, Development, DOM, J2EE, Management, QA, QA Testing, Release, Security, Testing, User Interface, Web Design
Frontend.jobDescription:
Folio Investing is looking for talented full-time Front-End/Angular Developers to utilize state -of-the-art web technologies to ensure our products look great and perform complex functions while being intuitive and easy to use. We are seeking self-motivated, enterprising developers with a thirst for emerging technologies; who strive to consistently develop cutting edge web applications. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to take their career to the next level!

Responsibilities

 * Work closely with designers and product managers to maintain a modern user experience.
 * Collaborate with other technology teams to ensure integrated end-to-end design and integration.
 * Work within the team to identify challenging engineering problems and come up with elegant solutions.
 * Create user interface that drive engagement.
 * Develop in a test-oriented and fast paced environment.
 * Coordinate with the product management team during technical design.
 * Resolve defects during QA testing and in post-release patches.

Qualifications

 * BS in Computer Science.
 * Experienced in modern front end framework (ReactJS, bonus points for Angular 2).
 * NodeJS experience.
 * Knowledge of native DOM and Event API's.
 * Solid understanding of browser quirks and their remedies.
 * Passion for current trends and best practices in Front-End architecture, including performance, accessibility, security and usability.

 Key Skills:  

 * Preferred development experience with Angular 2 and Typescript.
 * Significant experience with CSS preprocessors (LESS/Sass)
 * Ability to write high-performance, reusable code for UI components.
 * In depth experience with modern responsive web design.
 * Extensive experience with cross browser compatibility and browser degradation strategies.

 Preferred Skills
 * Domain expertise in financial services (brokerage experience preferred)
 * Understanding of Back-End application server technologies (J2EE/JEE)

Frontend.skills: Agile, Analysis, AngularJS, Business Intelligence, CSS, Developer, Development, Java, JavaScript, Lifecycle, Project, Security, User Interface
Frontend.jobDescription:
Req ID 95720BR Business Title Front End Developer with JavaScript Group MSS Location USA VIRGINIA Alexandria Clearance Level Needed None Category Information Technology Job Duties and Responsibilities 
ManTech is seeking experienced and skilled professionals to provide Business Intelligence Support Services to assist the Customs Border Protection to effectively and efficiently identifying cargo, individuals and conveyances that may present additional risk to the United States; conduct terrorism analysis and global assessments that convey changes in terrorism threats and identify emerging threats; develop and evaluate CBP-wide intelligence based targeting rules and intelligence driven special operations; and coordinate and enhance analysis and targeting efforts. 

   
The Java Developer-Front End with JavaScript will: 


• Design, implement and maintain modern Single Page Application user interfaces with modern JavaScript frameworks (specifically Angular JS and React) 

• Design and utilize REST APIs in Single Page Applications 

• Work with customers and team members in an agile development environment  

• Follow Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) best practices for code build and deployments 

• Present the solution at formal and informal design reviews, and document the design according to the Government’s system lifecycle methodology  


   

 Minimum Requirements: 


• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field  

• Minimum of 2+ years of modern JavaScript UI development experience using front end frameworks 

• Specific knowledge of AngularJS and/or React is required 

• Demonstrated expertise with User Interface technologies like HTML5, CSS/SCSS (experience using Bootstrap and Material Design is a plus) 

• Demonstrated experience in software engineering practices (e.g., reading/generating software specs, design patterns, continuous integration)  

• Demonstrated ability to think critically and creatively to develop innovative solutions to software problems  

•  Must meet the US Citizenship requirement and be able to obtain and maintain a Customs Border Protection Background Investigation 


   
Desired Skills: 


• Agile development experience a plus  

• First-hand experience working with large project teams (working with the Federal Government a strong plus)  

• TS clearance preferred   Qualifications Requires Bachelor’s degree (in Computer Science or related field) or equivalent, and two to four years of related experience. Degrees Equivalent Experience/Education 
 Bachelor's Degree 
Years of Experience 13-15 years w/High School Diploma 
 07-09 years w/Bachelors Degree 
 See Qualifications 
Position Type Full-Time Shift Day Overview ManTech International Corporation is comprised of approximately 7,300 talented employees who use advanced technology to help government and industry meet some of their greatest challenges around the world. We adhere to the simple, no-nonsense values on which ManTech was founded more than four decades ago, aligning squarely with the mission objectives of our customers. As our customer base continues to expand and diversify, we continue to diversify our workforce and solutions. Nearly half our employees have a military background, and approximately 70 percent hold a government security clearance. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nation's defense, security, health, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,100 active contracts with more than 50 different government agencies.

Frontend.jobDescription:
The Creative Group  is looking for a bright, enthusiastic, hard-working front-end web programmer to help build and launch state of the art, industry leading websites that interact with a complex back-end system and implement precise business logic. Candidates should have a well above average grasp of JavaScript, CSS, HTML and a solid understanding of web standards and usability. The ideal candidate should how to work from a strategy, contribute within a team, present with confidence and champion work that transcends digital tactics and leads brands 

Job Requirements 

2+ years of Design experience 

Highly creative with experience designing, developing and implementing web pages, landing pages and campaigns. 

 Proficiency in all aspects of front-end development including HTML, CSS, JS. 

 Proficiency in basic design platforms such as Adobe Photoshop, and Illustrator. 

 Experience in logo design and manipulation is a plus 

 Excellent time and project management skills to drive multiple project schedules simultaneously and ensure launch deliverables are met on time 

 Independent worker with strong self-motivation 

 Demonstrated ability to excel within a fast-paced environment of change 

 Accountable and keen attention to detail and proficient follow up 

 Solid quantitative/analytical skills. Google Analytics a plus. 

 Strong interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate effectively cross functionally with both technical and non-technical individuals. 

 Excellent written and verbal communication skills 

Send your Resumes and Portfolio's to Jose.Rodriguez@CreativeGroup.com  

Department:  Web Developer

Frontend.jobDescription:
If interested in being considered, please send resume to leigh.tracey@creativegroup.com 
The Creative Group  is looking for a Senior Front End Developer for a position in Northern NJ.  


 You should be able to translate our company and customer needs into functional and appealing interactive applications.. We expect you to be a tech-savvy detail oriented, who is curious about new digital technologies and aspires to combine usability with visual design. Ultimately, you should be able to create a functional and attractive digital environment for our company, ensuring great user experience. You should be able to hit the ground running on day one of the assignment.  


 What you'll be doing: HTML/SASS/JS work for a responsive React/Rails site. Work will largely consist of refinements and making sure the new site works well across platforms and browsers.  


If interested in being considered, please send resume to leigh.tracey@creativegroup.com 

Job Requirements 

3-5 years of proven work experience as a Front-end developer  

 Hands on experience with markup languages 

 Experience with CSS and jQuery, React, HTML/SASS/JS 

 Familiarity with browser testing and debugging 

 In-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment) 

 Understanding of layout aesthetics 

 Knowledge of SEO principles 

 Familiarity with software like Adobe Suite, Photoshop and content management systems 

 An ability to perform well in a fast-paced environment 

 Excellent analytical and multitasking skills 

 BSC degree in Computer Science or relevant field

Frontend.jobDescription:
Overview 
 

At Relativity, we make great software that helps users organize data, discover the truth, and act on it. Our product is used by more than 13,000 organizations around the world - in the cloud, on-premises, or both - to manage large volumes of data. 

 Here you can own your career in a community of values-driven people who help our customers around the world solve complex data challenges. If this sounds like the place for you, check out the details of this position below 


 As a Software Engineer, your primary mission will be to design, write, test, deploy and support new Relativity platform features. Your eagerness to learn new technologies and solve complex problems will make you the ideal candidate. Excellent communication skills are critical in this role as you will be expected to raise issues early and clearly document your code additions, test procedures, and project results. Your success in this role will provide you with extensive knowledge of the innerworkings of Relativity and open up a number of opportunities within our organization. 

IFRAME:   //www.youtube.com/embed/DXzdNBwaZjo?wmode=transparent 




 Responsibilities 
 

 You are a competent software engineer who is looking for a new challenge and would jump at a chance to work with a leader in a new, expanding industry. As a Software Engineer at Relativity, based in Chicago IL, you will design and build front end software for our web-based litigation support platform. This is your opportunity to work on a scalable and dynamic web system which supports integration with multiple search engines, clustering technologies, and client component interaction through web services. Additionally, you will learn how to build highly distributable systems composed of multiple database, processing, and web servers. If you have the desire to be continually challenged and work where boredom is an anomaly, then join our team and be part of a successful company experiencing rapid growth in the eDiscovery field. 


 You will be required join an after hour "on call" rotation to support the software your team develops. Urgent customer issues are given priority until resolved. 

 * Developing front end software for new Relativity features. 

 * Actively participating in our SCRUM process. 

 * Improving application system performance. 

 * Troubleshooting issues by fixing defects and responding to client specific problems. 




 Qualifications 
We are looking for candidates with:   

 * Entry-Level Software Development Experience 

 * Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Math or other related subject 

 * Experience in web development using JavaScript, ASP.NET, AJAX (especially JavaScript, you will be working with JavaScript a lot.) 


 * Experience with at least one other general programming language (C#/Java/Objective C/Python/Go, for example). 

 * Knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3. 

 * An interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed. 

 * Knowledge in working with Agile development methodology. 


 * Ability to speak and write English fluently and idiomatically. 

 * Effective communication and teamwork skills. 

 * Excellent knowledge of software engineering disciplines, including the ability to work comfortably in all layers of the Application Stack 

Would be awesome if you have:   

 * Experience with one or more JS framework (Aurelia, Angular, React, for example). 

 * Experience writing unit tests. 

 * Experience writing build scripts and plugins. 

 * Knowledge of CSS extensions (SASS, LESS, etc). 

 * Knowledge of package managers (npm, for example), bundlers (Webpack, for example), and task runners (Gulp, for example). 

 * Knowledge of new technology trends and their application in the marketplace. 

 * Knowledge of and adherence to SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) standards and best practices 


About Us 


 Our software has more than 150,000 active users in more than 40 countries from organizations including the U.S. Department of Justice, more than 70 Fortune 100 companies, and more than 195 of the Am Law 200. We have grown significantly over the last several years and continue striving to build software that helps solve our customers' toughest e-discovery and unstructured data challenges. 


 #LI-HA1 


 If you're ready to grow with us, we'd love to hear from you.

ABOUT NEXT COLLEGE STUDENT ATHLETE (NCSA)


NCSA is the world’s largest and most successful collegiate athletic recruiting network. A wholly-owned subsidiary of Reigning Champs ( www.reigningchamps.com), NCSA’s team of more than 650 former collegiate and professional athletes leverages 17 years of exclusive data, proprietary matching algorithms, and personal relationships to connect tens of thousands of college-bound student-athletes to more than 35,000 college coaches nationwide across 31 sports every year. You can learn more about NCSA at  www.ncsasports.org.

 

Senior Front-End Engineer Job Details


NCSA (Next College Student Athlete) is growing our Software Development team and we are looking for someone to lead a portion of the team, define and refine the process used across the team, and provide clear reporting on the progress made.  You’ll be working with a collaborative team of QA engineers, designers, developers, and product managers, so you’ll need to be able to articulate your decisions and take feedback into the next iteration. Want to work with a great team to make students’ lives better? Great!

HTML5, CSS or native UI/UX development fluency
Experience with React, Redux and application frameworks

Follow solid coding practices and standards

Experience directing or managing technical staff members
Experience finding areas of pain and fixing them
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Web Design skills with Photoshop or Illustrator
Familiarity with Jira or a similar issue tracking system
Un-afraid to manage up or sideways
Familiarity with standard source control methods
A team-player, always looking to make things better and easier for a co-worker

 

Benefits

Frontend.jobDescription:
Who is Markit Digital


We design, develop, and host data rich, full featured, and high traffic web and mobile applications for financial institutions, brokerages, and media clients from all over the world. We leverage a combination of our mature .NET stack along with the latest and greatest the industry has to offer to deliver some of the fastest and most utilized applications in the financial industry.  We work closely in teams to promote an inclusive environment with tons of idea sharing.   

What you'll do at Markit Digital
Contribute to a cross-functional team who are building amazing web sites for some of the biggest names in the financial industry
Mentor and learn from developers of all levels, evangelizing your knowledge and best practices to colleagues
Work with our clients to improve their current offerings in addition to conceptualizing new ways to engage with their clients
You will learn how to balance project timelines and team commitments in an exciting fast paced environment

 

How you'll do it at Markit Digital
Leverage your 2+ years of industry experience to provide your peers with a fresh point of view and a foundation for continued learning
Satisfy your natural craving for problem solving by building proof-of-concepts and designing applications
Tap into your passion for building great web experiences to create the next generation of industry leading web sites
You're smart and motivated enough to find a way, even if you don't know how yet

 

Required Skills:
JavaScript, HTML, CSS
Experience with ES2015
Experience with a front end rendering technology (React, Angular, Vue)
Prior development on a RESTful system

 

Bonus Points for:
React Native
Redux
Knowledge of accessibility requirements and responsive design
Continuous Integration Tools
ASP.NET/C#

Where we're going


Hot on the heels of moving our service oriented architecture to the cloud and automating our deployments and configurations, we're rolling out new tools to our stack like Angular, React, and Vue. We are always on the lookout for ways to make our sites more secure, scalable, and fast. We are continuing to explore our wealth of new data sources outside of the financial markets to pioneer new market spaces like virtual and augmented reality.

What you’ll be doing... 
  Verizon Corporate Technology's Big Data Analytics Group is looking for a Front End Engineer. This position is responsible for meeting the big data needs of our various analytics products and businesses. Specifically, this position is responsible for building state-of-the-art analytics solutions and applications that can be shared across product lines and businesses.   
  With over 100 million Wireless, Wireline, and Enterprise customers on our massive global network, big data products with analytics and visualizations are a critical component of our business. Stay on the front lines of groundbreaking technology. Be a critical part of an interconnected world through Data and Analytics.   
  Be a key developer of the Analytic Solutions and Visualization product development team.   
  Create visually stunning products using leading edge HTML5, React, CSS and JavaScript technologies.   
  Take requirements from Product Managers to assist tech leads in design and deliverables.   
  Collaborate with team members and other engineering teams to build solutions using multiple frameworks, libraries and front-tend technologies.   
  Communicate ideas and thought process clearly to team members and to strategic leaders.   
  Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues.   

What we’re looking for... 
  You'll need to have:   
  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or four or more years of work experience.   
  Four or more years of relevant work experience.   
  Experience building products.   

  Even better if you have:   
  A degree.   
  Relevant industry experience building products that delivers Analytics Visualizations, Reporting, Portals or Dashboards.   
  Experience programming in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery.   
  Good knowledge of D3.js and React-Redux.

  Good knowledge of Java, Spring Framework, App Servers.

When you join Verizon... 


You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon.  

Equal Employment Opportunity

Trimble is recruiting for a Front End Software Engineer, SketchUp Web Development Team to fill an opportunity in Boulder, CO. 

 Job Summary 


 The SketchUp engineering team in Boulder, CO is looking for a highly skilled, highly motivated software engineer. The position is a member of the SketchUp Development team and responsible for software engineering on the SketchUp and Trimble Buildings Web applications. Candidate should have experience writing web applications that scale to many millions of users and handle large amounts of data. 


 Key Responsibilities: 

 * Develop client-side Web application code for Trimble's 3D Warehouse. 

 * Develop server-side code, if you are comfortable 


 Skills/Experience Required: 

 * Knowledge of Web standards and protocols including JavaScript, HTML, CSS, HTTP, WebGL 

 * Experience working with Java 

 * Experience working with scripting languages like Python, Ruby, Node.js 

 * Experience working with modern frameworks, including Google Closure, TypeScript, SASS 

 * 0 to 3+ years' experience developing Web applications 

 * >3 years' experience is welcome too! 

 * BS/BA degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent experience 

 * Familiarity with common commercial software development best practices 

 * A test-driven development mentality 


 Skills/Experience Desired: 

 * Experience with Google App Engine and/or Amazon Web Services 


 Trimble is transforming the way the world works by delivering products and services that connect the physical and digital worlds. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics enable customers to improve productivity, quality, safety and sustainability. From purpose built products to enterprise lifecycle solutions, Trimble software, hardware and services are transforming a broad range of industries such as agriculture, construction, geospatial and transportation and logistics.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Job Number: 


R0021494 

Booz Allen Hamilton has been at the forefront of strategy and technology for more than 100 years. Today, the firm provides management and technology consulting and engineering services to leading Fortune 500 corporations, governments, and not-for-profits across the globe. Booz Allen partners with public and private sector clients to solve their most difficult challenges through a combination of consulting, analytics, mission operations, technology, systems delivery, cybersecurity, engineering and innovation expertise. 

 Front End Developer 

Key Role: 


Develop requirements and prototypes for analytic tools for countering WMD (CWMD) mission space and use existing technologies on classified networks to provide clients with CWMD situational awareness. Work with the task lead to identify development requirements and associate use cases with them. Work with multiple levels of technologies to synthesize robust and repeatable analytic processes and visualizations to support clients and create standard operating procedures for users. 

Basic Qualifications: 


-Experience in a professional work environment 

 -Experience with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS 

 -Experience with SharePoint or MVC Web framework, including Angular, Ember, Backbone, Knockout, or Backbone 

 -TS/SCI clearance 

 -BA or BS degree 

Additional Qualifications: 


-Experience with developing on closed networks 

 -Experience with Agile development 

 -Experience with databases, including SQL or NoSQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or Microsoft Access 

 -Experience with Python and other scripting languages, including bash, sh, or Perl 

 -Experience with Django, Model Mommy, or iPython Notebook 

 -Experience with TypeScript, ECMAScript, or Sass 

 -Experience with CI/CD tools, including Jenkins, SonarCube, Artifactory, or Gulp 

 -Experience with SCM and tools, including Git, Github, Gitlab, or Bitbucket 

 -Experience with ArcGIS, Leaflet, ArcGIS API for JavaScript, or ArcGIS Server 

 -Experience with the CWMD mission 

 -Experience in the nuclear, chemical, or biological fields 

 -Experience with the DoD or the IC as an analyst 

 -Experience with the IC, COCOM, or Interagency, including the Department of State or Department of Energy 

Clearance: 


Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required. 

 Integrating a full range of consulting capabilities, Booz Allen is the one firm that helps clients solve their toughest problems by their side to help them achieve their missions. Booz Allen is committed to delivering results that endure. 

 We are proud of our diverse environment, EOE, M/F/Disability/Vet. 

 AFH26

Frontend.jobDescription:
As a Front-end Engineer
, you will be working in a collaborative environment with product managers, business analysts, Drupal developers, and UX designers to help transform. You'll be responsible for translating design mockups into functional and accessible production-ready code, creating lightweight proof-of-concept prototypes, collaborating with back-end engineering teams, and working with Drupal themes.
Responsibilities:
Build web applications with high-quality, responsive, accessibility-compliant code
Ensure cross-browser, cross-platform, and cross-device compatibility
Work closely with product management and design to understand stakeholder requirements and craft elegant, usable, and technically-sound solutions
Extend and implement our internal UI pattern library 
Work closely with back-end engineers to ensure code quality and integration
Help to create code documentation to assist with ongoing support and maintenance of applications
Collaborate with vendors and other technical partners as needed

 
Required Skills & Experience:
Strong verbal and written communication abilities 
At least 3 years of experience in an applicable software development role
Expertise in modern HTML, CSS, and Javascript
Experience with component based UI development
Experience writing highly structured JavaScript
Working knowledge of CSS preprocessors like LESS or SASS
Experience with cross-platform, cross browser, and cross-device development and testing
Demonstrated ability to write documentation for both developers and non-technical audiences
Solid understanding of responsive design principles
Experience using Git version control
Experience working in an agile development environment
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment

 
Preferred Skills & Experience:
A Bachelor's degree or higher in computer science or IT strongly preferred; graduates from a bootcamps or other certification programs will also be considered
Experience working with PatternLab a strong plus
Familiar with atomic design methodology
Solid understanding of accessible coding requirements and Section 508 compliance a strong plus
Experience with Drupal and Drupal theming a strong plus
Experience with design tools like Sketch and Adobe Creative Suite a strong plus
Experience working with one or more modern Javascript frameworks like React, Backbone, Ember, or Angular

 
Additional Requirements:
Please include a list of projects the candidate have worked on including the role he/she played; your main responsibilities; length of assignment; and a link to code samples, Github repos, CodePens, or other technical documentation
 
Top 3 Technical Requirements:
At least 3 years of experience in an applicable software development role
Expertise in modern HTML, CSS, and Javascript
Experience with component based UI development

 
 NTT DATA Services is a leading IT services provider and global innovation partner with 130,000 professionals based in over 50 countries. NTT DATA  recently acquired Dell Services.  NTT DATA Services emphasizes long-term commitment and combines global reach and local intimacy to provide premier professional services, including consulting, application services, business process, IT outsourcing, and cloud-based solutions. We are a part of NTT Group, one of the world's largest technology services companies, generating more than $100 billion in annual revenues and partner to 80% of the Fortune 100. Visit www.nttdataservices.com to learn how our consultants, projects, managed services, and outsourcing engagements deliver value for a wide range of businesses and government agencies.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Requisition Number: 20170560 

Appointment Type: Staff - Contract 

Work Hours: 8:00am to 5:00pm 

Organizational Area: External Relations - Communications 

Location:Oakland, CA 

Posting Salary: Salary commensurate with experience 

Position Summary

The Marketing Communications department is setting new standards for interactive design experiences created for higher education. Under the general direction of the Chief Brand Officer, this position will lead technical execution of the department's web strategies and vision. 

The incumbent is responsible for providing website detail design, development, documentation, testing, publication, monitoring and maintenance of the end product. He or she will also evaluate and recommend new technologies as needed to sustain and extend high development standards. 

This position requires advanced technical skills, strong conceptual thinking, impeccable attention to detail, and an appreciation for visual design. It also requires close collaboration with designers and writers to assure that final 
web presentation conveys the desired messages in an engaging, usable way. 

Other Special Conditions of Employment
Successful completion of a background check is required for appointment to this critical position. 

Special Instructions/Additional Information
To apply for this position, please be prepared to attach your resume and cover letter as part of the application process. 

Job Close Date: Open Until Filled 

Job Duties
Duties
Website design and coding Testing
1. Translate requirements and visual design into final presentation for website development or enhancement.

Design, code, test, publish and maintain websites according to project specifications and group standards using XHTML, JavaScript, Actionscript and CSS, and maintaining cross--platform and browser presentation.

2. Evaluate and interpret the functional business needs and expectations to produce innovative interactive experiences.

Contribute to defining the interactive design models for new and existing projects by participating in discussions and creating site flows and wireframes.

Formulate strategies and criteria for selecting appropriate platforms for website and interactive experiences to obtain desired results.

Determine the feasibility and technical requirements of projects given the stated goals.

Research
3. Analyze, research, organize and develop other technology related projects as assigned.

Other duties
4. Other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements
Required
Bachelor's degree in related area and/or equivalent experience/training.

Minimum 5--7 years of applicable experience in web design/website development in an environment working closely with designers. (Online portfolio with examples of previous work and code samples will be reviewed.)

Demonstrated experience building websites in Drupal -- including custom theme development and management of core and contributed modules in a Linux/Apache/MySQL/PHP environment and other CMS platforms (WordPress, Cascade Server).

Demonstrated skill at translating complex Photoshop comps to clean, semantic markup with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.

Proven proficiency in industry standard concepts, practices and procedures using HTML5, CSS/SASS, JavaScript libraries (Jquery, Backbone, Underscore, React etc), frameworks (Bootstrap, Materialize, etc) and reusability of code. 

Working knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator, XD, Sketch, Invision.

Thorough understanding of cross-platform coding and browser compatibility issues and of web design in relation to site development.

Advanced experience with planning for deployment and creation of feedback mechanisms.

Demonstrated experience evaluating and recommending appropriate technology platforms to meet project objectives.

Strong interpersonal skills; ability to lead and work on cross--functional teams and foster the team's commitment to tasks.

Strong verbal and written communication skills with an ability to express complex technical concepts in business terms and complex business concepts in technical terms.

Self--motivated and curious, and a critical thinker who can analyze complex issues and deliver clear recommendations to leadership for meeting project objectives.

Experience with ADA compliance issues to ensure that web site information is accessible to people with viewing, hearing, motor, learning and/or cognitive disabilities and demonstrated knowledge of issues and guidelines.

Deep knowledge and use of best practices through relevant experience across web--based disciplines and technologies.

Demonstrated ability to perform competently under pressure; able to handle interruptions and changes without losing productivity.

Knowledge of HTML e-mail distribution systems.

How to Apply
For complete job description and application instructions, visit: https://jobs.ucop.edu 

About us
The University of California, one of the largest and most acclaimed institutions of higher learning in the world, is dedicated to excellence in teaching, research and public service. The University of California Office of the President is the corporate headquarters to the ten campuses, five medical centers and three Department of Energy National Labs and enrolls premier students from California, the nation and the world.

The University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age or protected veteran status.

Frontend.jobDescription:
At ProSight, digital innovation is key to our continued success and growth. The Digital team is a core component of our strategy to deliver a differentiated experience to customers and partners. The Digital team is responsible for developing online and mobile solutions for our customers, agents and employees through engaging interfaces enabled by cutting-edge technologies. We believe that the best solutions occur when the right mix of disciplines and skills are brought together on an integrated team that is open to ideas, is not afraid to push the envelope, and is ready to challenge the status quo of the Insurance industry. We are looking to build the core competencies of our team with people who are energetic, entrepreneurial, and driven by a desire to make a significant impact.

Our ideal candidate has outstanding JavaScript skills, is very experienced in AngularJS, and has a passion for code and technology. We are an agile team, so you will be a key participant in building applications and solving complex business problems. You will look for the best, and most efficient, patterns for solving a problem; if you’ve never had experience with it, you are willing to dig in and learn. Our ideal candidate is flexible, adaptive, prefers simplicity over complexity, is self-motivated, and exhibits a bias for action

 

Responsibilities:


 
Develop the client-side user interface of single-page web applications, that closely adhere to visual designs and established design standards, ensuring that they render appropriately across multiple devices and browsers
Participate in design and requirements planning, providing feedback based on your knowledge of client-side controls, patterns and best practices
Work within, and help establish, client-side coding guidelines, to ensure reusability, modularity and efficiency
Work closely with your product team to prioritize and implement new application features, while simultaneously maintaining the quality of existing features and functionality
Monitor the performance of production web applications to look for opportunities for optimization
Assist the product team in managing and grooming the product backlog, assigning points to backlog items to correctly establish velocity, and establishing sprint goals
Own the planning, completion, integration and quality of the code you produce
Stay up to date with technology, tools, design trends, and industry best practices to help evolve the brand and team skills

Qualifications:


 
Preferred 3+ years’ experience developing responsive, single-page applications using the AngularJS framework
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field, or equivalent work experience
Deep knowledge of HTML, CSS, REST, JSON, NODE, Bower and similar modern web frameworks/technologies, including Foundation, Bootstrap, React, or similar
You are comfortable with Agile development tools such as Basecamp, Visual Studio Team Services, Jira Agile, or VersionOne
Working knowledge of source control systems such as Github
Working knowledge of debugging, performance monitoring, benchmarking, logging and testing tools
CMS experience is not required, but is a plus
Your code is clean, efficient, and you strive for reusability in your designs
Strong technical understanding of the full stack of digital technologies (browser and server-side), and how they combine to deliver a superior user experience
Strong customer orientation
Effective verbal and written communication skills
Ability to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner
Motivated to create meaningful product experiences for users
Customer-centric, willingness to deep dive to understand customer needs and business drivers
Have a voice to communicate effectively with people who may not speak your “language” as a developer
Passion to succeed and continually improve skills
Desire to exceed expectations and to manage multiple projects while meeting tight deadlines
Detail-oriented and organized
Excellent problem solver and comfortable in a fast-paced environment
Capacity to set expectations and be self-directed
Team player

Frontend.jobDescription:
Overview 
 

At Relativity, we make great software that helps users organize data, discover the truth, and act on it. Our product is used by more than 13,000 organizations around the world - in the cloud, on-premises, or both - to manage large volumes of data. 

 Here you can own your career in a community of values-driven people who help our customers around the world solve complex data challenges. If this sounds like the place for you, check out the details of this position below. 


 The Sr. Software Engineer will join the Engineering Operations department is responsible for delivering results for the Product Development department by: 


 o Contributing to an Agile team that solves complex challenges and builds working software for both on premise and cloud-based infrastructure 

 o Rapidly producing high quality code 

 o Being a dependable and highly skilled development resource for peers 

IFRAME:   //www.youtube.com/embed/DXzdNBwaZjo?wmode=transparent 




 Responsibilities 
 

 The Sr. Software Engineer performs the following functions, in addition to others, in the administration of their position: 

 * Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code. 

 * Prepares and installs solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming. 

 * Improves operations by conducting systems analysis, recommending changes in policies and procedures. 

 * Encourages pair programming and collaborative design 

 * Thinks out loud- Consistently communicates ideas to others 

 * Provides development expertise to team members through education and review 

 * Always open to new ideas and encourages innovative practices amongst peers 

 * Works collaboratively with QA professionals to encourage defect prevention over detection 

 * May be required to handle technical support calls after hours about two times a year. 


 In addition to the above responsibilities, the Senior Software Engineer is expected to display professionalism in the following ways: 

 * Maintain an attitude of commitment through outward display of willingness 

 * Practice positive interactions - lean on encouragement in place of judgment 

 * Impress responsibility on others by displaying ownership in tasks 

 * Act in the best interest of the overall team 




 Qualifications 
 

 * Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related disciplines 

 * 7+ years of software development of commercial-grade systems and applications in c# or java with experience in full stack development 

 * 2-3 years of experience with JavaScript and angular JS preferred 


About Us 


 Our software has more than 150,000 active users in more than 40 countries from organizations including the U.S. Department of Justice, more than 70 Fortune 100 companies, and more than 195 of the Am Law 200. We have grown significantly over the last several years and continue striving to build software that helps solve our customers' toughest e-discovery and unstructured data challenges. 


 If you're ready to grow with us, we'd love to hear from you.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Leading Web Services and E-Commerce company seeking a full-time Web Designer to complement our growing team in Madison, Wisconsin. Wisconsin Interactive Network, LLC, a Madison-based subsidiary of eGovernment firm NIC (NASDAQ: EGOV), helps Wisconsin government entities Web-enable their information services. Our electronic government solutions use technology to increase efficiency and reduce costs for governments and their constituents. 

 We are seeking an enthusiastic and motivated candidate who thrives in a fast paced environment to join our team as a Web Designer. This position will oversee the design of new leading edge Web/mobile/e-commerce applications and services. The selected candidate will have the opportunity to work with a team of highly versatile and talented project managers and developers. 



 Job duties in a few tidy bullet points:   

 * Designs, constructs and maintains website and web application interfaces 

 * Works with a project team to determine interaction design and application work flow, and creates XHTML/CSS prototypes to demonstrate how the application should flow 

 * Designs usable and attractive interfaces based on best practices for mobile, web and responsive design, and that are enthusiastically adopted by the public 

 * Constructs application pages using current Web languages and techniques and ensures that pages are standards compliant (i.e., W3C), universally accessible (i.e., Section 508, W.C.A.G.) and validate to cross-browser compatibility 

 * Ensures the proper functioning and accessibility of any scripting or programming languages, and resolves advanced programming/interface/appearance issues 

 * Performs usability research, testing and analysis and uses the information collected to effectively solve usability problems 

 * Contributes to the general functioning and effectiveness of the organization by engaging in activities such as special projects, creating presentations and promotional items, report preparation, and other similar duties 



 You will definitely need all this:   

 * Undergraduate degree or equivalent work experience 

 * Minimum of four years' related experience 

 * Proficiency in HTML, CSS and jQuery 

 * Desire and ability to work in fast-paced, highly flexible and entrepreneurial environment 

 * Enjoy working both independently and within small project teams 

 * Exceptional customer service skills and effective presentation skills 

 * Strong leadership, organizational and prioritization skills 

 * Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously 

 * Excellent communication skills including strong written and verbal abilities 

 * Self-motivated and proactive 

 * Able to provide a portfolio of previous work upon request 

 * Experience with Sharepoint 2007/2010 



 Benefits:   

 * Competitive compensation program 

 * No-cost group medical/dental insurance 

 * Stock purchase plan 

 * Matching 401(k) contributions with 100% vesting 

 * Disability insurance 

 * Life insurance 

 * Company wellness program 

 * Casual and fun office environment 

 * Paid State holidays/vacation 

 * Tuition reimbursement 


 Think this sounds awesome? 

 We do too, so let us see what you look like on paper! Please submit your resume, references and any of the following: cover letter/writing sample/work samples and we will take a look and let you know what we think! 


 NIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer, to view our Equal Opportunity policy, visit http://www.egov.com/careers.

Summary / Description

We are currently seeking a motivated, career and customer oriented Front End Java Developer (UI)
 to join our team in Falls Church, VA,
 to begin an exciting and challenging career with Unisys Federal Systems.
 
Responsibilities:

 
Building dynamic web applications using Java technology stack and experience in the development of desktop browser and mobile web-based UI.  The candidate must have strong UI development skills using Angular2/4 and be well versed with Typescript/Javascript/JQuery.  The candidate will predominately work on UI development using Angular2/4.
 
The candidate must be willing to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple assignments and must actively support and contribute to the Agile practices adopted by the development team.  Must have a proven history of building responsive web applications and working as a multi-tier developer who can contribute to development efforts on database, server and user interface components.
 
Required Skills:
Angular 2/4/Typescript/Javascript/Html5/CSS 
Web services using REST 
Good knowledge of Oracle SQL
JAVA/JEE
Spring /JPA/ Hibernate
Agile SCRUM 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate with internal and external customers
Work with external teams to resolve testing issues and bug fixes. 
Experience with large-scale enterprise wide IT environments containing multiple technologies, servers and logical environments
Ability to obtain a federal security clearance
Strongly Preferred Skills Sets:


• Knowledge and experience of building Applications in a cloud based environment
Requirements


Position Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree and minimum 10 years of related experience or equivalent
US Citizen
CBP-BI Clearance or ability to obtain one

About Unisys

Do you have what it takes to be mission critical?
 

Your skills and experience could be mission critical for our Unisys team supporting the Federal Government in their mission to protect and defend our nation, and transform the way government agencies manage information and improve responsiveness to their customers.  As a member of our diverse team, you’ll gain valuable career-enhancing experience as we support the design, development, testing, implementation, training, and maintenance of our federal government’s critical systems. 

Apply today to become mission critical and help our nation meet the growing need for IT security, improved infrastructure, big data, and advanced analytics.

Unisys
 is a global information technology company that solves complex IT challenges at the intersection of modern and mission critical. We work with many of the world's largest companies and government organizations to secure and keep their mission-critical operations running at peak performance; streamline and transform their data centers; enhance support to their end users and constituents; and modernize their enterprise applications. We do this while protecting and building on their legacy IT investments. Our offerings include outsourcing and managed services, systems integration and consulting services, high-end server technology, cybersecurity and cloud management software, and maintenance and support services. Unisys has more than 23,000 employees serving clients around the world. 

Unisys offers a very competitive benefits package including health insurance coverage from first day of employment, a 401k with an immediately vested company match, vacation and educational benefits. To learn more about Unisys visit us at www.Unisys.com.


Unisys is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) - Minorities, Females, Disabled Persons, and Veterans.
