What You Will Be Doing

As a Senior Frontend Engineer you will help design and build the mobile app and and web site application that will provide the gateway for our cryptocurrency platform using React Native and React. You will assist in designing the user experience, as well as implementing and connecting to our back end services.
In this position you will work on a small team with other top talent with a significant impact on design, architecture and direction. You will interface with and work directly with the back end and cloud services teams as well as Product Management to help launch our platform.

•Design and build the front ends, including mobile and web applications, working in conjunction with back end teams to produce a world-class fintech service
•Create intuitive, simple and effective designs via wireframe and mockup tools, working directly with Product Management, and then follow through with implementation.
•Build quality in, delivering significant unit, integration and system tests along with your code
•Write developer documentation, reference implementations, wireframes/mock-ups and other educational content as needed
•As a secondary objective, assist the other teams directly with code review, design and implementation as needed

What You Need for this Position

We're looking for passionate, professional software engineers who enjoy doing things the right way. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Javascript, React Native and React, as well as user experience design, code security, quality and sustainability. Experience with Python and microservices will be useful to provide the depth we are looking for in this position. As a software professional, you understand the importance of coding clean, estimating, taking deadlines seriously, and interfacing well with other team members and teams.

- At least 5 years experience building enterprise grade mobile and web applications
- Deep knowledge of Javascript and both React Native and React

Experience with:

•User experience design
•Unit and system testing
•Software security concepts and best practices
•Front End: Javascript, React and React Native
•OS: Linux

•The opportunity to join a well funded, cutting edge financial technology company at a very early stage
•Competitive salary and equity
•Competitive medical benefits
•Generous 401K matching plan
•Flexible working policies: work with your manager to determine the best combination of work at office/work from home arrangements
•A software culture that values quality, sustainability and craftsmanship over time to market
•Smart co-workers who are world class experts in the field of crypto-currency
•A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impactSo, if you are a Senior Front End Engineer (React, React Native) with experience, please apply today!

Frontend.jobTitle: Senior Front-End Architect - JavaScript, MVC, CSS3
Frontend.skills: JavaScript, MVC, CSS3, HTML5, Erlang, Ruby On Rails, MySQL, Redis - JavaScript, MVC, CSS3, HTML5, Erlang, Ruby On Rails, MySQL, Redis
Frontend.jobDescription:
Minimum Required Skills:
JavaScript, MVC, CSS3, HTML5, Erlang, Ruby On Rails, MySQL, Redis

Our modern San Francisco headquarters make us easily accessible by all public transit.

What You Will Be Doing

You will be working as an individual contributor to help architect our front end architecture to improve the development workflow, create proper separation of concerns and abstractions to optimize development while keeping the site fast.

What You Need for this Position

7+ years of related work experience
- You understand how front end architectures can be optimized to improve developer productivity while properly separating concerns.
- Expertise in JS and CSS – we write in ES6, use babel to transpile down to ES5, and use SCSS as our CSS Preprocessor
- Strong knowledge of modern MVC frameworks, and the libraries and tooling surrounding them. Rails, Elixir and React preferred.
- Experience and deep understanding of modern development standards, HTML5, CSS3 and cross-browser compatibility issues
- A desire to write great, clean, secure code and always striving to implement features in the best way possible. You've thought ahead about what's to come, thought of all the edge cases, and have proved that with tests. RSpec and Jasmine preferred
- An obsession with new technologies and trends – we don't mind testing new tech out where it makes sense for our products!
- A self-starter mentality, who can work independently and collaboratively. We're a small team, and communication is key in allowing us to move quickly.

Our core stack:
- Ruby on Rails, as our web application framework
- React, built on a custom front end framework following the flux architecture
- Erlang/Elixir, which our real time API has been built in Elasticsearch, pulling from RDBMS and NoSQL data stores
- MySQL and Redis, to store our data
- Ruby On Rails
- MySQL
- Redis

What's In It for You

- Great culture (we're a tight team)
- San Francisco headquarters, easily accessible by all public transit
- A fun team environment with frequent outings and retreats
- Annual Tripping Travel Credit! 
- Generous benefits package  (medical, dental, and vision)
- 401k
- Local gym discountSo, if you are a Senior Front-End Architect with experience, please apply today!

If you are a Front End Software Engineer with experience in  Angular 2, Node.JS, and JavaScript, please read on!

Located in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, we are one of the highest paid start-ups in our industry. We pride ourselves on our Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence Platform. For our clients- we are appealing because we provide the ability to create any sort of AI application on any device, prior to coding. Frontend.jobDescription:
Responsibilities
The Front-End Web Developer is responsible for the translation of UI/UX design wireframes to actual front-end code for a stellar user experience, targeting Mobile-first but with full understanding of the impact of the interactive desktop experience. The Front-End Web Developer will work closely with the designers and bridge the gap between graphical/brand design and technical implementation, creating an engaging user experience. The ideal candidate is proficient in JavaScript (JQuery & AngularJS), C#, ASP.NET MVC, HTML5, CSS, and typescript, related to web development. We are seeking an experienced developer /coder/ui-designer who understands the full-stack web server environment and knows how to solve complex problems. The ideal candidate will be excited about the incredible opportunity to help elevate digital marketing experiences and will be passionate about collaborating with great teams that deliver high quality web experiences. You will enjoy working in a fast-paced environment that requires strong technical and business judgment and great communication skills.
 
·         Develop high-quality digital experiences including websites, emails and other marketing campaigns across our global online properties
·         Build responsive web page, and other user-facing features with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other programming languages including SQL
·         Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.
·         Optimization of Web sites for maximum speed and scalability on all devices.
·         Implementing Mobile-First Design and Development Concepts, understanding differences between multiple delivery platforms (adaptive and responsive), and optimizing output to match the specific platform
·         Understand best practice marketing processes and align technology solutions to optimize those processes across the business
·         Assist with managing our Content Management Systems (KenticoCMS) in the development of dynamic templates, customization of Web pages and user interface components to support a library of easily reusable components.
·         Assist with the administration of the Content Management System's users, roles, workflows and training.
·         HTML/Code debugging and QA testing utilizing tools such as the built-in browser debuggers, Fiddler, and External browser testing such as BrowserStack or SauceLabs.
·         Support global CMS implementation, supporting content and interface design in 15+languages.
·         Collaborate with content experts and digital concept designers to a creative, cohesive and engaging user experience.
·         Ensure current SEO best practices are built into all development projects.
·         Assist in managing enterprise-marketing online video platform (Kaltura).
·         Maintain a up-to-date library of design/development documentation and style guides.
·         Responsible for high standards of performance of assigned work and driving oneself to meet commitments and deadlines.
·         Work closely with your team in an Agile/SCRUM based environment to meet the needs of our clients.
·         Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
·         Continue to stay current on digital design trends relating responsive design, UI/UX best practices and technology innovations and uses that information to make innovative recommendations.

Location: Seattle, WA 
Duration: Perm/Direct
Compensation: Deluxe Compensation Package (Generous Base, Bonus, Sign-on, World-class Benefits, etc.)
Start Date: ASAP 



Our Seattle client is looking for an experienced Engineering Manager with extensive Front End development experience. This person will be managing a team of Engineers and will work closely with product owners and engineers to design, implement, test and continually improve low latency and highly scalable web applications and services running on AWS.

Responsibilities

Mentor and assist other engineers in or out of your areas of ownership and expertise.
Be a technical lead for key complex systems or services, working closely with other engineers and testers to deliver high quality software on time.
Investigate, evaluate, and present new technologies for use with web applications / services.
Develop products using Agile methods and tools.
Develop commercial grade software that is user friendly and suitable for global audience.
Support production issues both directly and indirectly with customers.
Lead design reviews, code reviews of your work and the work of your peer engineers.
Lead or participate in architecture and design efforts across multiple teams.
Work closely with other engineers and testers to deliver high quality software on time.

Desired Skills and Experience

BS in Computer Science or equivalent.
5+ years software development experience building commercial web front end applications.
4+ years experience with Linux, and Linux based scripting.
3+ years developing software with test automation or Test Driven Development.
2+ years of technical management experience.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Very self motivated and self driven.
Exceptional service level design and programming ability.
HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Angular.js
Git
Node.js 
JSON, using REST services, HTTP

Open Source licensing

Web page security e.g. XSRF, XSS, SQL injection, SSL, etc.

Jasmine/Karma test frameworks or equivalent
Understanding of Big Data technology, including queuing mechanisms, NoSQL storage solutions, large scale processing systems, or event/stream based processing platforms.
Understanding of statistics modeling and machine learning.

Frontend.skills: Javascript, HTML5, CSS3, Lead, Node.js
Frontend.jobDescription:
About the Role

Our client, a leading mobile fitness and health platform for Android and iOS is hiring a software engineer that specializes in recommendation engines and search. Most engineers at this 18 month old, 100 person company are responsible for developing across the stack- everything from client APIs to the search and recommendation systems. In this role, you'll be leading a team of Javascript Engineers who are fluent in Javascript / Node.

About the Role



Building out a new web experience for our users is a crucial next step for our business. In this role, you'll be responsible for leading the team of engineers tasked with doing this. This is a player-coach role and you should expect to be very hands-on. You will spend about 75% of your time working in the code whether that's building a new feature yourself, pairing with a team member or reviewing a PR. The remaining time will be spent working with Product to plan upcoming projects and managing your team. You will be responsible for holding regular one on one meetings with your reports and providing constructive feedback. This is a role that provides a huge opportunity to have a meaningful impact on Aaptiv's business.

What You'll Do

Develop new features in the React.js / Node.js web application. This will be mostly frontend work, but will also require some backend work as well. You should feel comfortable with both.
Work closely with product managers to brainstorm ideas, break down projects and estimate how long they will take
Be a champion of engineering best practices within your team. We want to build high-quality software that's easy to understand, easy to change and works the way it's supposed to.
Manage and mentor a small team of engineers. You'll be responsible for making sure they have the guidance they need to grow as engineers.

Who You Are

5+ years of experience as a software engineer working on both the frontend and backend
2+ years of experience in a leadership role
Expert knowledge of JavaScript and CSS
Experience using modern web frameworks such as React.js, Ember.js or AngularJS
Strong understanding of good API design
You value code quality, but understand that perfection is not the goal. More importantly, you know when it's appropriate to make tradeoffs.
You firmly believe in engineers writing automated tests and you have experience with testing frameworks for front end applications
You are always willing to pitch in to help your team no matter what the task may be

Qualified candidates will have approximately 2+ years of experience implementing engaging front-end experiences with HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript.  Experience with AngularJS is preferred but any modern framework like Backbone, React, Ember, etc. are okay.  Additionally, candidates should have 1+ years of experience with Ruby on Rails and should be comfortable working with the back-end of the stack when needed.  The breakdown is approximately 75% front-end, 25% back-end development.  Any experience with Agile methodology is a plus.  BSCS or equivalent is required.

The Front-End Web Developer will work in a fast-paced, dynamic team environment and must demonstrate excellent communication and organizational skills.  You will participate in full life-cycle development including requirements, design, development, etc.  This position includes competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package.  Qualified candidates should send a copy of their resume to nyjobs@cypressg.com for immediate consideration.  Local candidates only please.

Frontend.skills: React, Redux, Immutable.js, Typescript
Frontend.jobDescription:
A fast-growing, venture-backed software company that is powering more effective and accountable government. They are the leader in government performance solutions: easy-to-use software for better  budgeting, improved reporting and operational intelligence, and comprehensive citizen transparency and open data. Their solutions give governments the right tools and relevant data for more informed decision- making and better outcomes for the public.

Senior Front-end Engineer Description


As a senior member of our client's front-end engineering team you'll build best-in-class SaaS solutions that enable efficiency, transparency, and accountability within government agencies. You'll be a key member of our engineering team, delivering new features and improvements in a fast-paced, agile environment using modern technologies, including React, Redux, Immutable.js, and TypeScript.

A typical day in this role would provide opportunities to optimize applications for speed and scalability, resolve a variety of unique technical challenges, and contribute to the overall capabilities of our operational intelligence platform. Strong collaboration skills with product, UX, and back-end engineers, along with the ability to execute quickly will enable your success. Passion for good component design and solid application architecture come naturally to you, as does navigating the troubled seas of browser compatibility. We value natural self-starters with the ability to communicate ideas effectively and contribute to our culture of respect, dedication, and fun. You value clean code, principles over dogma, and making the world a little better everyday.

Responsibilities
Produce reusable and readable code and libraries
Develop new UI features and improve existing code
Write unit and integration tests to improve and maintain high code coverage
Work with local and remote engineers on a regionally distributed team

Qualifications
5+ years professional experience in front end engineering roles
3+ years professional experience using Git or another popular CVS
2+ years professional experience using Linux CLI
1+ years professional experience with React and Redux
Strong understanding of functional programming fundamentals

JavaScript, REACT, Redux, jest, Webpack, SASS, UI/UX, Responsive Design, Nightmare, Apiary

If you are a Senior React/Angular Front End Developer - with experience, please read on!

Top Reasons to Work with Us

1. We offer the opportunity to grow with a great, passionate tech company building Fleet Navigation Applications
2. We are a great blend of startup and established
3. We give you the chance to build new and exciting projects

What You Will Be Doing

This job blends both the cultures of an established company and a startup. We are doing a complete revamp by building a new product line from the ground up, but we also have the continued backing of a successful business to see the project through unlike so many startups today. You and our Senior Software Architect will be building the platform of the future using our existing application merely as a guide for what needs to be done, all while having significant autonomy in deciding how that gets done. Imagine building an enterprise application so that it's done the right way, without fighting through beuracracy and limitations of past design decisions from years ago. This is a developer's dream project!

What You Need for this Position

Our ideal candidate is a seasoned (3+ years experience), front-end JavaScript developer to create a React/Redux client for an AWS SaaS solution.

This is a permanent, direct hire, full-time programming position that requires candidates to work onsite and be permanent residents. Willing to pay top dollar for the right person ($80k - $120k). The ideal candidate takes great pride in delivering high quality work on time, and handles great autonomy with care!

Must be proficient in JavaScript, React, Redux, Jest, Webpack, Sass, UI/UX, responsive design, and API-based client application development.

Experience with ES6, Material-UI, Enzyme, Nightmare, and Apiary a definite plus.

What's In It for You

$90-120K Base pay based on experience
We offer 10 days of PTO, 5 sick days, and 8 holidays

Job Description 
Senior Front End Engineer 
Outstanding Company, Great Benefits, Amazing Culture 
We are looking for experienced engineers to help build a front end engineering team in our Raleigh, NC office. The Raleigh office is one of the fastest growing sites in the company. We are aggressively building our local engineering presence and are looking for experienced engineers to help us shape & establish our engineering culture. 


Backing our front end, our core data processing engine exemplifies Big Data. It already processes tens of billions of records daily; we are revamping it to be more scalable, in execution time, data volume and resource usage. We are improving our operational infrastructure & processes to support a rapidly increasing, global customer base and expanding data volume. And we continue to introduce new features, enhancements and even entirely new products, by finding innovative, new insights in the rich sea of data we ingest. 


We have lots of fundamental decisions ahead of us on what to build, how to build it, test it and support it. We are looking for engineers that embrace the challenge of tackling large problems and want to construct the foundation of the engineering team. 


Requirements 

Bachelor's degree in a related field. 
4+ years experience developing customer facing user interfaces. 
Excellent knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS fundamentals. 
Strong grasp of modern javascript frameworks and technologies, such as ES6, React, or Angular. 
Experience with web development build systems: Yarn/NPM, Grunt, Gulp, or Webpack 
Results driven. You don't want to just write code -- you want to ship code, have it used by customers 



Bonus
Experience with public cloud platforms such as AWS 
Software development & delivery in a SaaS environment 
Working in high growth startups

Top Reasons to Work with Us

Based in Santa Clara, CA, we are disrupting education by transforming the way millions of students learn.  Voted Glassdoor's "One Of The Best Places To Work" in 2015, our work here today will improve and shape education for future generations! We're just getting started, and you have the opportunity to play a big role in our future. We are looking for bright and energetic individuals who are passionate about technology and are looking to make a difference.

As an employee here, you will be given the resources to be successful, and have a lot of ownership and autonomy. We foster a culture that is consistent with our mission and vision around continuous learning from and developing each other and our careers.

What's In It for You

We are willing to offer an excellent compensation package of $110k - $175k with unlimited PTO. Our PTO policy is simple, we don't have one. Our employees work with their manager to schedule time off and we don't track it. We also offer medical/dental/vision benefits, 401k with matching, tuition reimbursement, and a college loan reduction program. Also we have a fun working environment with a fully stocked kitchen, lunch on us every day, foosball, Ping Pong, Pool Table, Wii, and on site gym.

What You Will Be Doing

We are looking for a top-notch JavaScript engineer with well-rounded experience in data visualization to join our Outcome team to build our next revolutionary data discovery product. The Outcome team main focus is building products to help students connect with higher education admissions officers as well as helping students through their early stage career success.

•  Develop awesome features for our high traffic web front end supporting learning services products.
•  Code, test, document and deliver features with cross-browser compatibility, accessibility and search engine optimization
•  Collaborate with product managers, designers, QA and other engineers to enhance existing UI
•  Participate in agile development process, including scoping, detailed design, effort estimation, coding, testing, debugging, code reviews, maintenance and 
support

What You Need for this Position

• 5-8 years of consumer-facing web front end development experience
• Proficient with native JavaScript as well as working experience with modern web frameworks, including React, Redux or MV*
• Proficient in latest open standards such as ES6, CSS3 and HTML5 and able to make the right choices when building responsive UI applications
• Good knowledge with server side JavaScript is a big plus (Node, Express, Koa, etc.)
• Proficient in Data Visualization techniques, JS libraries and best practices is a plus  (D3, cross-filter, etc.)
• Familiar with RESTful API structure
• BS or MS in Computer Science or a related fieldSo if you are an energetic and fun individual who is looking for the chance to make a meaningful impact on others, please apply now!  Interviews begin this week!

Front-End Developer 
São Paulo, Brazil  





  About us 



Red Ventures is the world’s largest technology-enabled platform for growing sales and optimizing the full customer lifecycle. We own the entire direct marketing funnel for our Fortune 500 brand partners - from demand generation to closing the sale. Our expertise spans multiple industries including Home Services, Energy, Financial Services, Insurance and Software.  


The front end team, part of the technology team, is responsible for developing and maintaining complex, robust and high-performance applications with other Red Ventures engineering teams. This position has high visibility and potential to impact the organization by directly participating in the way we build and deliver the solutions to our partners.  


Our culture is based on freedom, you will be free to run, test and learn and you will have the responsibility to self-manage in a collaborative and agile way. You will have the opportunity to challenge yourself and grow. You could think of the best of both worlds: work in a dynamic start-up environment in Brazil and at the same time be supported by a leading global technology company in a disruptive, entrepreneurial, accelerated career environment.  

What you will do 



You'll work building complex applications that work across devices and words like performance and mobile first will be part of your routine. You'll work with designers, analysts, engineers, and other developers in an environment where you can see the impact of your ideas. Red Ventures will give you the opportunity to innovate and make meaningful decisions as you continue to develop your skills.   

Who are you 

Familiarity with the responsive design environment, always looking for breakpoints that breaks your UI. 
Attention to small details and UI interactions. 
Experience with at least one client-side JavaScript framework such as React, Angular, Ember or Vue. 
Deep understanding of the Javascript fundamentals. 
As you will work with designers and developers from all over the world, you should feel comfortable communicating in English. 
Availability to work in person in our office in Sao Paulo. 

Nice to have (but not required) 

Experience with build tools - Webpack. 
Apply Now

 with the skills and the drive to build and maintain digital experiences for some of the country’s biggest brands. You’ll work with top talent including writers, analysts, designers and other developers in a fun, fast-paced environment at our headquarters in Fort Mill, SC (relocation assistance provided). Each day, you'll create, code and optimize websites and user experiences in a workplace where you can see the impact of your ideas.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Cinder is looking for a Front-End Application Engineer to fill a role for our clients in Lake Oswego, OR. This is a full time, 40 hour per week opportunity with a full benefits package that includes PTO! 

 Our client is looking for a strong Front-End Developer who is a wizard with JavaScript tools of many flavors, loves maps and who is not timid around endpoints and requesting clean contracts between the front and back ends of the system. You're not satisfied with creating the bare minimum UI - you always have a desire to bring the user's experience to the next level. You have a self-starting style and an independent ability to deliver, but also a strong desire to collaborate with professionals from many backgrounds. You will be responsible for developing a brand-based application built on a clean framework taken from concise business and technical requirements. We are looking for candidates who have a deep knowledge of front-end development and a desire to use their skills on a modern microservice stack to support multiple apps and data systems handling over $150mm in transactions. 

 Job Duties may include but are not limited to: 

 * Consistently write quality code with unit tests 

 * Work effectively with the team to collaborate towards a killer application 

 * Analytical, problem-solving skills in fast moving culture 

 * Collaborative and innovative with a high degree of intellectual curiosity 

 * Works well with others, communicates when needed 

 * Leader for "best practices" 

 * Affinity with maps and UX development 

Required Skills:   

 * Bachelor's degree in computer science, math or related STEM fields; more extensive experience may be substituted 

 * 3+ years experience in JavaScript and PHP/Java application development 

 * Experience in React (or Angular), Redux, Sass (or LESS), Node, Git, and Webpack, as well as testing tools like Karma and Mocha 

 * 5+ years working as a programmer at a company in a team environment. 

 * Ability to learn and understand business goals to develop intelligent solutions 

 * Experience with distributed code repos and pull requests 

 * Prior experience supporting multiple browsers, operating systems and devices 

Preferred Skills:   

 * Prior development on a RESTful system 

 * Prior experience with Mapbox GL JS and ESRI 

 * Prior experience with AWS 

 * Prior experience with data models/schemas (or schema-less) 

 * Prior experience with macOS 

 * Prior experience on an Agile team 

 * Prior experience with Software as a Service products 

Work Environment:   

 * Job Location: Must be done onsite 

 * Shift: Normal business hours 

 If you are looking for a professional, challenging, stimulating environment and meet the above criteria, please apply now!! 

 US Citizens and all other parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time. No third party candidates considered for this position. 

 Cinder is a rapidly growing consulting firm based in Beaverton, OR. We are bringing a new perspective to the staffing industry, providing a better experience for both customers and employees. Our collaborative company culture and positive work environment are a refreshing alternative to traditional staffing firms! Frontend.jobDescription:
Job Description 


Provides technical support and basic development for computer applications and programs. Uses diagnostic tools and/or analyzes and uses vendor specifications to troubleshoot complex computer application problems to maintain or restore service or data to programs, leads the resolution of complex issues or escalates as needed to meet established service level agreements. Completes required logs and reports. Prepares programming specifications and completes programming tasks to develop basic, and/or assist in the development of moderately complex, computer solutions. Performs modeling, simulations and analysis. Prepares program test data, tests and debugs programs. Updates and completes documentation, procedures and user guides. Understands BCP, quality, security and compliance requirements for supported areas and analyzes changes for risk to the environment. Participates in testing and updating the business continuation plan. Provides assistance and guidance to less experienced staff. 
    
We are seeking an individual with the following traits: 

 Solid understanding of all of the following:  C#, .NET, JavaScript (ES5, ES6+), TypeScript, HTML5, and CSS3   

Proficient in industry standard IDE tools and technologies (Visual Studio Professional 2015, VS Code) 

 Deep understanding of JavaScript development toolchains (Node.js, NPM, RequireJS, GULP, Aurelia CLI)  

 Deep understanding of Aurelia JavaScript Single Page Application Framework   

 Knowledgable in software development patterns and practice  

 Knowledgable in JavaScript SPA authentication and authorization (OAuth2/JWT)  

  Applicant needs to be a proven and strong individual contributor.  The individual must be capable of taking high-level direction and execute to success with minimal assistance.  The individual must be an excellent communicator and be familiar with software development best practices.  The individual must be able to focus on front-end UI development for the web including an emphasis on user experience.   
Required Qualifications 


 
 5+ years of application development and implementation experience  
 5 + years of computer application development experience  
 3+ years of web design and development experience  
 3+ years of .net experience  
 3+ years of JavaScript development experience  
 3+ years of experience testing end user applications and technology products  


Desired Qualifications 


 
 Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills  
 A BS/BA degree or higher in science or technology  
 3+ years of JavaScript framework experience (YUI, Angular, Node)  


Other Desired Qualifications 



 Working experience with Aurelia SPA Framework  

 3+ years working as a web front-end user experience designer/developer  

 Experience working with multiple JavaScript front-end development tools and technologies – Babel, Materialize, jQuery, Angular JS in addition to Aurelia  

 Experience working with large-scale datasets  

Job Expectations 


Disclaimer 


 
 All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  




 Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  


 Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Cinder is looking for a Front-End Application Engineer to fill a role for our clients in Lake Oswego, OR. This is a full time, 40 hour per week opportunity with a full benefits package that includes PTO! 

 Our client is looking for a strong Front-End Developer who is a wizard with JavaScript tools of many flavors, loves maps and who is not timid around endpoints and requesting clean contracts between the front and back ends of the system. You're not satisfied with creating the bare minimum UI - you always have a desire to bring the user's experience to the next level. You have a self-starting style and an independent ability to deliver, but also a strong desire to collaborate with professionals from many backgrounds. You will be responsible for developing a brand-based application built on a clean framework taken from concise business and technical requirements. We are looking for candidates who have a deep knowledge of front-end development and a desire to use their skills on a modern microservice stack to support multiple apps and data systems handling over $150mm in transactions. 

 Job Duties may include but are not limited to: 

 * Consistently write quality code with unit tests 

 * Work effectively with the team to collaborate towards a killer application 

 * Analytical, problem-solving skills in fast moving culture 

 * Collaborative and innovative with a high degree of intellectual curiosity 

 * Works well with others, communicates when needed 

 * Leader for "best practices" 

 * Affinity with maps and UX development 

Required Skills:   

 * Bachelor's degree in computer science, math or related STEM fields; more extensive experience may be substituted 

 * 3+ years experience in JavaScript and PHP/Java application development 

 * Experience in React (or Angular), Redux, Sass (or LESS), Node, Git, and Webpack, as well as testing tools like Karma and Mocha 

 * 5+ years working as a programmer at a company in a team environment. 

 * Ability to learn and understand business goals to develop intelligent solutions 

 * Experience with distributed code repos and pull requests 

 * Prior experience supporting multiple browsers, operating systems and devices 

Preferred Skills:   

 * Prior development on a RESTful system 

 * Prior experience with Mapbox GL JS and ESRI 

 * Prior experience with AWS 

 * Prior experience with data models/schemas (or schema-less) 

 * Prior experience with macOS 

 * Prior experience on an Agile team 

 * Prior experience with Software as a Service products 

Work Environment:   

 * Job Location: Must be done onsite 

 * Shift: Normal business hours 

 If you are looking for a professional, challenging, stimulating environment and meet the above criteria, please apply now!! 

 US Citizens and all other parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time. No third party candidates considered for this position. 

 Cinder is a rapidly growing consulting firm based in Beaverton, OR. We are bringing a new perspective to the staffing industry, providing a better experience for both customers and employees. Our collaborative company culture and positive work environment are a refreshing alternative to traditional staffing firms! Frontend.jobTitle: Full Stack/ Front End Software Engineer - Data Processing (200K+)
Frontend.skills: Algorithms, Architecture, C++, C#, Compilers, Consulting, Development, Java, Management, Programming, Project, Software Engineer
Frontend.jobDescription:
Full Stack/ Front End Software Engineer - Data Processing (200K+)   

Our client builds software to create high performance, massively distributed, parallel data processing platforms that solves the most complex business problems in the world 


The core platform is written in Java and C++ but the firm is language agnostic and open to technologists with Java, C++ or C# backgrounds. 


The ideal candidate is focused on building systems the right way and has had success solving complex enterprise level issues. 


Our client is looking for the best engineers, and will pay 100% relocation expenses. 

  
Project Scope:  


  

They are currently looking for Front End and Full Stack Developers to completely redesign their entire front end in a completely greenfield development project. 

  
Contribution/Impact: 


  

You will be building the complete UI used by fortune 100 clients and their millions of customers globally 

Software Development 


Our technology is the ultimate Big Data / High Performance application development platform in the world.  And that takes the best software developers in the world to envision it, build it, and make it work. 

  

Our development organization is composed of small teams of senior people, with very little management to get in the way.  We don’t even have “product managers” – the staff is responsible for determining product direction and deliverables.  A critical part of our experience is lots of customer interaction, via rotations through our support organization, occasional on-site consulting engagements, and exciting proof-of-concept projects. 


Because our platform is an application development environment, we have to address many challenges in computer language design, compilation, and execution.  A graphical programming language that really “works” is one of computing’s holy grails!  Our goal is to build a very sophisticated/scalable/high performance platform while still making it easy for our users to graphically express their business logic.  This requires a very strong knowledge of computer science, algorithms, operating systems, computer languages, databases, and the like. 


Our technology spans a tremendous range.  This starts with our user interfaces that make complex concepts and processes simple to express and manage for our customers, who themselves are experts in their business but are usually less technically advanced.  Another whole dimension is tracking, categorizing and analyzing everything about the users’ environments through metadata management. 


We have an infinite amount of work to do, from user interfaces, through compilers, to run-time engines.  But we always stay true to the approach:  We always try to think things through “From First Principles” before we do anything.  While architecture is critical, everyone in our development organization is “hands-on”. 


All development work on our products occurs at our headquarters in Lexington Massachusetts.

We're a highly collaborative environment, but our team is also self-motivated and works independently. We strongly believe that great products aren't be created in isolation. Our dev team interacts with our healthcare customers to understand their needs and ultimately deliver the best user experience possible. The position is almost entirely remote - we have our daily stand up via Slack and you'll be asked to come in a handful of times a month.

 

The Opportunity: 

We're growing like crazy and we're just getting started. Our team is extremely motivated but also a lot of fun, and most importantly, we're passionate about solving healthcare's messiest problems with new technologies. The role is Chicago based with the option to work from home. Competitive salary, annual bonus, healthcare benefits, annual conference/training budget and opportunity for LTI.

High level of motivation, initiative and sense of urgency

Ability to dive into multiple technologies at a time

Full Time | Reston, Virginia 


Job Summary: 


We're looking for a Front End Software Engineer to help built and scale the controller for our high performance virtualization platform. Unlike traditional virtualization, our platform is controlled by via a cloud portal (imagine if vCenter were SaaS). This portal enables the customer to provision, manage, and non-distruptively upgrade on-premise infrastructure. 
Job Functions:

Write performant, client-side code for high volume, production applications using HTML/CSS/SASS, TypeScript, and AngularJS
Implement design specifications according to wireframes
Fix bugs identified by the quality assurance engineering team
Integrate front end applications with backend services
Write unit tests to verify code and protect against future regressions
Collaborate with engineers and designers to implement solutions to business requirements

Required Skills:

Ability to work independently as well as with peers
Strong knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
Experience with JavaScript MV* frameworks (AngularJS, ReactJS, Ember.js, KnockoutJS, etc.)
Exposure to JavaScript task automation tools (NPM, Webpack, Grunt, etc.)
Familiarity with data serialization formats (JSON, XML)
Github profile with contributions to personal, professional or open source projects OR
Personal website, blog, or portfolio demonstrating competence in the field

Education and Experience:

BS degree in engineering, computer science, or information technology with 2+ years of professional experience
Experience with CSS preprocessors (Sass and/or Less)
Experience with Twitter Bootstrap or Zurb Foundation
Interpersonal skills to succeed in a professional environment

Nice to have:

Experience with TypeScript
Understanding of RESTful API design for web services
Experience with unit and end-to-end testing (Karma, Jasmine, Protractor, etc.)
Experience with back end development (Java, Ruby, .NET, Python, Node)

Application Process :


Please include one of the following:
Github profile with contributions to personal, professional or open source projects.
Personal website, blog, or portfolio demonstrating competence in the field

 

About Cloudistics:


Smartphones and computers are everywhere (like the one you’re using to read this). Technology runs businesses, and the economy. Cloudistics makes it easy for businesses to use technology.

Our solution eliminates traditional virtualization, storage, and networking silos and replaces them with a single, high performance, easy to manage solution. We’re fundamentally changing the way businesses consume infrastructure and IT services.

Fairness Matters:


We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Work with a small, innovative team developing an entirely new application as we expand our product and platform offerings.
Evolving our web experience to use fast and fluid rendering and interaction technologies.
Build great consumer-friendly interfaces that allow consumers an equally effective experience across both web and mobile browsers.
Evolve our "run-anywhere" HTML5 experience to use fast, fluid, native rendering and interaction technology.
Design and tune novel approaches for high performance with Big Data on performance-constrained browser or mobile devices and networks.
Code in and learn multiple technologies across our suite of desktop, server, cloud, and mobile solutions.

 

Skills / Qualifications


 
You have high standards, and your software practices ensure you deliver high quality even under schedule pressure. For instance, you believe in constantly releasable quality, iterations, design for testability, and you build your own tools and techniques to achieve high quality and low cost of support. You deliver more results by using quality practices every day, and you even have taught or influenced others to improve their practices. Demonstrated ability to code a delightful user experience/flow.
Team Player. You enjoy collaborating with, learning from, and teaching others so we all become better. You assume good intent in others, and actively do your part to make a positive work environment.
Self-Motivated. You don't need to be micromanaged.
Strong skills and experience in JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3. Experience or familiarity with one or more web frameworks such as AngularJS, Backbone, Ember, Bootstrap, and Knockout. Ideally, you have experience developing large-scale web or mobile applications.
Interest in diverse applications and user communities.
At least 3 years’ experience developing commercial web applications.

If you are a Front End Developer with 10 years of experience, please read on!   -- For immediate consideration, email your resume to evan.bates@cybercoders.com --

Top Reasons to Work with Us

Based in San Francisco, CA, we are disrupting education by transforming the way millions of students learn.  Voted Glassdoor's "One Of The Best Places To Work" in 2015, our work here today will improve and shape education for future generations! We're just getting started, and you have the opportunity to play a big role in our future. We are looking for bright and energetic individuals who are passionate about technology and are looking to make a difference.

As an employee here, you will be given the resources to be successful, and have a lot of ownership and autonomy. We foster a culture that is consistent with our mission and vision around continuous learning from and developing each other and our careers.

What's In It for You

We are willing to offer an excellent compensation package of $150k - $180k with unlimited PTO. Our PTO policy is simple, we don't have one. Our employees work with their manager to schedule time off and we don't track it. We also offer medical/dental/vision benefits, 401k with matching, tuition reimbursement, and a college loan reduction program. Also we have a fun working environment with a fully stocked kitchen, lunch on us every day, foosball, Ping Pong, Pool Table, Wii, and on site gym.

What You Will Be Doing

As a part of the tutors engineering team, you will help to build a cutting edge platform that will define the future of online learning. In this role, your strong skills and knowledge in modern web platforms, frameworks, and techniques will be put to the test while you help students save time, save money, and get smarter.

Responsibilities: 
•  Create and present full-stack architecture for complex technological challenges
•  Implement end-to-end solutions in code, leading junior engineers to help you
•  Be a role model for code quality, accuracy, and perfection of your solutions
•  Communicate and collaborate with product managers, designers, researchers, and data scientists to deliver the best user experience
•  Create documentation and teach at regular learning sessions

What You Need for this Position

•BS (or equivalent) in Computer Science or related discipline
•10+ years of experience developing web applications with modern JavaScript programming frameworks, tooling, and libraries like React
•Strong Computer Science fundamentals with competencies in software design, data structures, and problem-solving
•Expert knowledge of vanilla JavaScript, CSS, HTML
•Expert knowledge of at least one popular JS framework: React / Angular / Backbone etc.
•Experience with CSS processors: SASS (preferable), LESS

Nice to Have:
•Knowledge of Java, Python, and/or Django
•Familiarity with a modularization API such as RequireJS or AMD
•Familiarity with front-end testing tools such as Mocha, Chai, or Karma
•Experience with cloud service providers such as AWS
•Experience with Unix command line, commonly used POSIX commandsSo if you are an energetic and fun individual who is looking for the chance to make a meaningful impact on others, please apply now!  Interviews begin this week!

Frontend.jobDescription:
Qualtrics is a rapidly growing software as a service company backed by three of the top venture capital firms in the world, Sequoia Capital, Accel Partners and Insight Venture Partners.  Our world-leading insight platform has transformed the way businesses collect, analyze, and act on valuable insights that drive better decision-making.  We offer a single experience management (XM) platform that captures customer, market, and employee insights in one place.  


The Core Research Platform engineering team is what drives Qualtrics XM Platform.  You will be building leading edge technologies that will enable our customers to collect the data they need across the 4 key XM funnels.    

As a Software Development Engineer, you will be applying your distributed systems knowledge, familiarity with frontend development, databases, various storage engines, and web service design and implementation to create world class software and services.   Each team has freedom on choosing the stack on each project, allowing engineers to experiment and learn new, up and coming technologies like, reactjs, GoLang, Scala, Spark and Galera.  Primarily, our stack includes AngularJS, node.js, Java, PHP, JavaScript, mongoDB, MySQL, and Cassandra. 
You should    love    building simple solutions to solve hard customer problems.  Designing systems in an agile environment to withstand hyper growth. Owning quality from end to end is a rewarding challenge and one of the reasons Qualtrics is such an exciting place to work! 
In addition, you will: 
Develop scalable, fast, robust, and simple web-based solutions to solve complex business problems 
Implement new features and optimize existing ones to drive maximum performance 
Have worked on frontend development and have familiarity with backend services 
Work closely with, and incorporate feedback from other engineers, tech-ops, and product managers 
Attend daily stand-up meetings, collaborate with your peers, prioritize features, and work with a sense of urgency to deliver value to your customers 



  Experience required 

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science 
2-8 years of relevant experience 
Strong level of curiosity and interest to learn 
Strong algorithms, data structures and coding background 
Disciplined approach to testing and quality assurance 
Experience with web infrastructure and distributed systems 
Experience with software engineering best practices (e.g. unit testing, code reviews, design document)

Currently seeking a Senior Front End Developer to join our Application Development team.  Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX designs and wireframes to actual code that will produce the visual elements of our websites and applications. You will work with the UI/UX designers, and the rest of the development team, to bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation.

Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders to ensure the technical feasibility on UI/UX designs and translate them into technical requirements or user stories 
Participate in the creation of interactive prototypes and annotations for new features or projects 
Design, develop, test, review, deploy, and support desktop, custom web, and mobile applications.

New York City based ad-tech startup Vistar Media is currently seeking front end engineers to help grow its connected devices division. The successful candidate will be part of a team focused on IoT and Smart Cities projects.

 

Vistar Media is the leading technology company in the Digital Out Of Home industry. A big part of Vistar’s mission is to make the screens out in the world smart enough to react to a variety of data inputs, and then use that data to build a dynamic, engaging experience on the fly. The connected devices team builds the backbone technology that powers internet connected screens and other types of hardware.

 

You will be part of a highly skilled engineering team and be able to make an immediate impact. As one of the early team members, you will play an integral role in shaping up our core technology. Your work will be highly visible and critical to our success. You will be exposed to a variety of technologies from networking to desktop applications on multiple operating systems and you will have the chance to learn and own parts of the system.

 

If this sounds exciting to you, we would love to hear from you!

Understand HTTP and Websockets

Are familiar with browser technologies like V8, WebKit, Compositing, etc
Know how to do memory profiling for a web app
Have built a desktop application using native frameworks or with Electron-like technologies

Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs  



Honeywell is transforming from a traditional industrial company to a contemporary digital industrial business, harnessing the power of cloud, big data/analytics, internet of things, and design thinking. We are bringing value to our customers, partners, and shareholders through the creation of innovative software and data-driven products and services. Honeywell IT is at the forefront of this change and we are looking for a team member who thrives on meaningful the status quo, embraces new technology and intelligent risk taking, has real passion for innovation, is results-oriented and excels in a fast-paced environment. The IoT Platform team is building next generation of cloud platform that will be used as a base for all of Honeywell’s future Connected Building, Connected Plant, Connected Home, Connected Worker, Connected Car and Connected Aircraft offerings. As an IoT Platform software engineer, you will play an important role in transforming our company into an Industrial Software company. 

Design, implement and verify User Interfaces for massively scaleable, fault-tolerant IoT Platform capabilities and applications 

Contribute to the architecture design of Honeywell’s enterprise IoT core services platform 

Be the Go-To person for other teams developing products against the IoT platform 


You must have 

•  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related discipline 
•  2+ years’ experience in JavaScript, JSON, CSS and HTML5 technologies 


We value 

•  Working knowledge of web UI libraries and frameworks (single page applications, AngularJS, data visualization – D3, MEAN stack) 
•  Passion to develop high-quality and high-efficiency User Interfaces 
•  Experience with multiplatform development, including responsive design 
•  Understanding of server based technologies (C#, .NET Framework, Java) 
•  Familiarity with relational and NoSQL databases 
•  Excellent teaming skills, actively collaborate with engineers and peer teams 
•  Working experience with agile environment 
•  Possess solid understanding of software development fundamentals 
•  Ability to multi-task and stay organized in a dynamic work environment 
•  Passionate about learning new technologies and creating innovative solutions 
•  Self-directed and able to troubleshoot and take on problems independently as well as a team 
Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status. Exempt Created with Snap          Review and assess product development requirements  New development on cutting-edge applications in Angular  Develop feature specifications  Troubleshoot & resolve User Design/IoT platform issues  Constantly learn to remain current on latest UI trends  INCLUDES 
Continued Professional Development 
1st Shift 
Some Travel Required 
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION 
Job ID:  req128588 
Category:  Engineering 
Location:  715 Peachtree Street, N.E., Atlanta, GA 30308 USA 



Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.  

ZRCORP

Frontend.skills: crm
Frontend.jobDescription:
In this role you will be responsible for:

 

· Develop high-quality digital experiences including websites, emails and other marketing campaigns across our global online properties

· Build responsive web page, and other user-facing features with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other programming languages including SQL

· Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.

· Optimization of Web sites for maximum speed and scalability on all devices.

· Implementing Mobile-First Design and Development Concepts, understanding differences between multiple delivery platforms (adaptive and responsive), and optimizing output to match the specific platform

· Understand best practice marketing processes and align technology solutions to optimize those processes across the business

· Assist with managing our Content Management Systems (KenticoCMS) in the development of dynamic templates, customization of Web pages and user interface components to support a library of easily reusable components.

· Assist with the administration of the Content Management System’s users, roles, workflows and training.

· HTML/Code debugging and QA testing utilizing tools such as the built-in browser debuggers, Fiddler, and External browser testing such as BrowserStack or SauceLabs.

· Support global CMS implementation, supporting content and interface design in 15+languages.

· Collaborate with content experts and digital concept designers to a creative, cohesive and engaging user experience.

· Ensure current SEO best practices are built into all development projects.

· · Maintain a up-to-date library of design/development documentation and style guides.

· Responsible for high standards of performance of assigned work and driving oneself to meet commitments and deadlines.

· Work closely with your team in an Agile/SCRUM based environment to meet the needs of our clients.

· Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

· Continue to stay current on digital design trends relating responsive design, UI/UX best practices and technology innovations and uses that information to make innovative recommendations.

 

Basic Qualifications


(These are the minimum qualifications you need to be considered for the job)

 

· Bachelors or greater in Information Technology, Computer Science, Web/Digital Design, or a related field.

· 5+ years related experience in Web design/development and management working within an enterprise Content Management Systems (CMS), with an existing brand, and in integrating Web assets as well as managing complex functions related to these tools (e.g. KenticoCMS or others, including SharePoint, SiteCore, Ektron, OpenText, WordPress).

· Must have expertise with Web design, UI/UX and graphics using standard Web design/development software such as Adobe Creative Suite: Photoshop, Dreamweaver, Illustrator and Acrobat.

· Familiarity with development aiding tools (Visual Studio)

· Proficient understanding of code versioning tools (Git,VSO)

· In-depth understanding and working knowledge of Web development programming languages with a mastery of the syntax, with experience with mobile/responsive design standards:

· HTML5, CSS3

· Client-side scripting, JavaScript frameworks, including Bootstrap 4, AngularJS and JQuery

· W3C standards, browser compatibility, accessibility guidelines

· SQL syntax and transformation concepts

· Expert knowledge of the modern web stack – from the presentation tier (HTML/CSS/JS) to webservers and caching, server-side development (including database development), and the management of hosting infrastructure

· Experience with Google Tag Manager and Google Analytics implementation and development to support event-based tracking, data-layers and advance reporting dashboards.

· Proven skills to write thorough and accurate technical documentation.

· Be someone who actively seeks learning opportunities and applies acquired knowledge to the job.

· Understands how to identify, diagnose, and repair problems within Content Management Systems.

· Strong understanding of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) best practices for Web development, navigation and architecture.

· Experience with Microsoft Operating Systems and Microsoft Office 365.

Frontend.skills: HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Frontend.jobDescription:
Fast casual is causing a revolution in quick service dining. From mobile ordering apps to curbside food delivery, the restaurant industry is quickly modernizing as customers look for a more complete experience when they dine. Coates Group has provided solutions to QSR leaders since 1963, and are primed to be a big part of this transformation. HQ'd in Australia, Coates is building out an office in Chicago in support of tremendous growth in North and South America. 
So where do you come in?

Whether Coates is providing drive through technology or ordering kiosks, all solutions are dependent on the content that is delivered. With that said, the team at Coates wants to add a UI developer that has an eye for the aesthetic. The technical tool box required is the oft requisite HTML, CSS and JavaScript. In this role, we are looking for someone that has a few years using said toolbox that is ready and interested in changing an industry by delivering digital solutions to an industry that has been analog way too long. 

Are you ready to take your work beyond the browser? Drop us a line and let's chat.

Frontend.skills: JavaScript, HTML, CSS, AngularJS, Agile
Frontend.jobDescription:
Solu Technology Partners has an excellent opportunity partnering with a top local firm to support development and maintenance of software to augment a successful and evolving product line. The candidate will be a member of a small, agile project team focused on delivering new functionality within the customer-facing application suite. They will be expected to serve as a technical resource contributing in areas of architecture, design and hands-on development.

Responsibilities:

Work effectively within a large code base to design elegant and efficient solutions for new problems within the context of an existing implementation
Apply application specific technical skills to independently produce deliverables (i.e. specifications, program changes, unit test scripts, documentation, etc.)
Exemplify and uphold rigorous personal and team code quality and process standards
Develop, maintain and unit test software solutions to produce robust, performant production deliverables
Identify and communicate solution options with both non-technical and technical team members
Acquire and utilize basic business knowledge to support applications
Support software updates during quality assurance, user acceptance testing, and post implementation to ensure integrity of application
Design, develop, test, implement, and support technical solutions across and within agile teams across a wide range of development tools

Fundamentals: 

Self-motivated, results oriented and comfortable setting and meeting deadlines
Excellent written and communication skills - ability to effectively document and present ideas both verbally and visually
Strong problem solver - ability to document and communicate solution options, design and implement solutions and identify and resolve issues quickly
Strong listener - ability to quickly understand and incorporate general direction and specific feedback in project work
Naturally detail oriented with ability to balance value versus effort
Passion for new and innovative technologies guided by end-user, technology and business drives
Performs basic analysis and design for program changes to gain an understanding of application changes.

Qualifications:

Analysis/Design - Strong understanding and appreciation for object-oriented analysis and design, particularly Service-Oriented Architectures
Software Development Life Cycle - Agile experience preferred
Proficiency with JavaScript, HTML, XML, JSON required – other modern web technologies including AngularJS, JQuery, JSP, CSS3, and HTML5 a strong plus
Experience with Integrated Development Environment (Eclipse, IntelliJ, etc.); Version Control (RTC, Git, SVN, etc.) – GIT preferred; Build Tools (Ant, Maven, Jenkins, etc.) – Jenkins preferred; Code review and static analysis tools – Code Collaborator, Crucible
Understanding of web/application servers – Tomcat and JBoss preferred
Proficiency navigating and administering Windows and Unix/Linux via command line
Experience or interest in the areas of Business Analytics, Continuous Integration, performance-oriented engineering or process improvement a strong plus
Mobile Development with responsive web design is strongly desired

Minimum Qualifications:

BS in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering or related discipline
5-7+ years of industry experience designing, developing, maintaining and delivering large-scale solutions

 

Solu Technology Partners provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Description 

InsideSales.com  offers the sales industry’s first comprehensive sales acceleration platform that creates high performance sales teams with breakthrough technology, and increases the revenue of their customers’ world-wide by applying our machine learning and innovative technology.  Our product is pure technology, supported by a predictive machine learning engine.  

InsideSales.com  is growing incredibly fast and is funded by some of the top venture capital firms, as well as by Salesforce and Microsoft.   Our leadership team hails from great companies including Salesforce, eBay, IBM, Infor, Citrix, VMware and Amazon.  We have high expectations and have attracted great leaders who have enjoyed a similar ride elsewhere, and are excited to be here.  


Joining a fast growing company is a great way to accelerate your career. We’re transforming how SALES is done, applying technology to revolutionize and modernize.  Want to bet on your career and learn a lot?   Come join us. 


Engineering for scale: 


InsideSales.com  builds for the cloud, deploying as a software as a service (SAAS) platform.  We have a portfolio of seven products, and are very focused on building a true platform of micro-services.  We’re initiating a major transformation of our platform to realize this vision.  


You’ll learn about building a large scale platform of distributed micro-services, using cutting edge technologies.   

We need you if you: 


Love a challenge – the best technology problems are those tackling really hard business and scaling problems 
Delight in building scalable, fast, robust and elegant software in modular components 
Are proud in producing high quality solutions and iterate until they are truly awesome 
Learn constantly about new technology, challenges and lessons from your mistakes 
Cooperate in a team environment where you can learn from your peers and they can learn from you 



Many job descriptions read like a shopping list for the impossible.  At the core, we’re looking for great software engineers.  Technologies change, but great minds transition.  That said, the following set of qualifications are relevant and useful to the problems we’re solving:  

Position Responsibilities: 

Work closely with product owners, senior engineers, designers, programmers, and QA to deliver industry-leading solutions 
Responsible for constructing solutions based on customer requirements 
Contribute to the implementation of major features and components from requirements and designs 
Contribute to the creation of functional and technical specifications 
Responsible for contributions in technical design, task estimation, implementation, automated testing, debugging, and deployment 
Participate as a productive member of an agile team of engineers 
Produce high quality, test-driven software 
Assist in planning, costing, designing and testing 
Communicate well with product managers, customer support, and other team members 
Promote established standards, processes, procedures, and tools throughout the software development life cycle 
Responsible for Tier 1 services for identity management and license management 



  Requirements: 

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent and/or the ability to show us that you are a great engineer 
3+ years of software development, ideally in B2B Saas or a B2C web environment 
Experience mentoring junior engineers and leading design efforts on complex systems 
A demonstrable track record of building great software 
OOP, web, and services experience.  All the skills to build great distributed and complex systems 
Experience in working in small Agile teams and iterating to build great solutions 
Ability to work in a Linux environment 
Experience in building RESTful services across some combination of Node.js, Go, Scala, Python, C#, Java.  
Web development skills in Javascript, preferably with React or AngularJS. 
Database experience – both SQL and NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra, etc) 
Experience with queuing technologies including RabbitMQ 
Experience with cloud deployment  services, like AWS. 



InsideSales.com offers competitive compensation, generous benefits including a matching 401(k) program, healthcare insurance and reimbursement accounts, as well as a gym membership and ongoing training & education programs.

Job Title:
 Front End Web Developer

Location: 
NYC (midtown)

Job Type
: Contract Duration:
 6 months +

Contact Info
: Ella Blank - eblank@techlink.com - 201-786-2414

Overview and Responsibilities:

Our client has an immediate Front End Web Developer opening.
This is an exciting opportunity for the right person, as the company is embarking on a next generation user interface geared towards substantial increase of traffic and revenue.
The Developer will work with the application development team on technical design, development, and maintenance of Internet applications for public facing web properties and content management system.
This position reports to the Director of Technology and works closely with other front-end and back-end developers, as well as product managers, project managers, and designers.Day-to-day responsibilities include:

Realization of written requirements into deliverable work.
Coding of complex and dynamic web interface components.Candidate must have demonstrated experience with the following:

You are a top notch HTML, CSS, and JavaScript developer.
You have expert understanding of client side development including HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, cross browser/platform compatibility, web standards, semantic web and SEO.
You know AJAX, DHTML, JSON and JavaScript frameworks such as JQuery, BackboneJS.
AngularJS, ReactJS, Bootstrap, Jasmine, etc. You are familiar with different JavaScript libraries and frameworks
You have expert knowledge of Response Design, Mobile Web and worked with it in several web projects.
You are equally focused on performance of the site.
You understand progressive enhancement and graceful degradation concepts.
Adobe CQ, or other WCMs. You have worked with content management systems (CMS)
You have experience with SDLC as well as Agile development methodologies.
Integrations with different plugins client side for Facebook, Twitter, web analytics and advertising solutions (Omniture/DART), etc.
Firebug, Charles, Grunt, Yeoman, Bower, SVN, CVS, Git, etc. Comfortable with different front end development tools and code management systems
Photoshop and image production/manipulation.

Candidate Profile:

Able to work in a fast-paced team environment and be adaptable to the demands of all levels and types of production duties.
Commitment to getting results for time-sensitive launches, promotions and events.
Able to contribute to and implement best practices, with an emphasis on code reuse and shared code libraries, but maintain a degree of flexibility for quick delivery.
Must be a team-player, capable of juggling multiple projects, great communication, detailed oriented, web standards driven and a self-starter.
Must be able to absorb a lot of information and produce quickly.
Willing to take technical risks and envision next generation models.
Strong design aesthetic who understand big picture and critical thinker.
Must have excellent English, oral, and written communication skills.

Maintain an atmosphere of professionalism.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Job Title: Senior Front End Engineer-
 React


Location: Sunnyvale, CA


Duration:  12+ Months


 


Job Description
:


We are seeking a talented Senior Engineer with strong Front end experience and a proven track record of building high quality scalable web applications, and solid leadership abilities. You will be responsible for implementing pixel perfect designs that balance challenging customer needs with application performance. Requirements: - BS in Computer Science or related technical field required.

ü  Qualified Full Stack Engineer with strong emphasis on Front End Experience with proven experience with React JS or equivalent, Node.js and Javascript.

ü  Experience in HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3, AJAX, Responsive Design, and general Web 2.0 techniques in the context of interactive Web Applications

ü  Experience with XML and XSLT technology

ü  Experience with building fast and efficient web applications with pixel perfect design

ü  Experience with deployment technologies like Capistrano or equivalent

ü  Experience with Source Code Management Tools (GitHUB)

ü  Experience with frontend performance optimization tools like Pagespeed etc.

ü  Experience with Source Code Management Tools (Github)

ü  Experience developing using relational databases such as Oracle or MySQL

 


Additional Job Details

As a Software Engineer in Search Tools team, you will be making a positive impact on our Customer experience.
The Tools are used daily by Merchants, Engineers and Executives to make informed decisions, change User Experience, etc.
All teams within our Search team — business, evaluation, operations, system, big data, leadership — depends on the data we gather about business and needs to make impactful decisions.
Our work is high-impact: it makes the entire Search team, particularly the product operation team, able to iterate faster and react to changes that accelerate business growth.
As a Search Tools’ member, you will have visibility into every other team.

 


Position Description

Design high performance, highly scalable web application.
Build and maintain new features on supported Tools platforms.
Work with business and PM to draw and visualize key insights.
Stay abreast of the fast moving field of Web UI, SPA, big data, open source.
Leverage and improve upon the computing resources of the world’s largest retailer.

 

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related fields with 3-5 years of experience as software engineer or similar role.
Proficient in Javascript
Proficiency with the Web architecture, at least one modern javascript framework (React.js preferred).
Excellent communication skills.

 

Additional Preferred Qualifications

Experience building SPA (Single Page Apps).
Experience building services using back end technologies (Nodejs, Rails)
knowledge of SQL and database technologies (Hive, MySQL, Cassandra, MongoDB)
Knowledge of Ruby and Python
Self-starter who is willing to learn new technologies and dive-in to imperfectly-formed technical questions.
Building novel visualization tools that help Search team members easily use core datasets to generate insights.
Deep knowledge in computer science fundamentals and software design best practices.
